An easy to learn, hard to master set collection game with a wealth of strategic possibilities.
Gorgeously illustrated with over 200 unique designs.
 Featuring 180 historical works of art, each with accurate information about the painting and where it is currently exhibited. 
From 2 to 4 players with a duration of 20-30 min per player.
In Museum: Pictura, players take on the role of aspiring museum curators! Their goal: to acquire the most Prestige points in order to make their establishment the greatest in the world.
This is done primarily by assembling Collections of some of history’s greatest paintings. The larger these Collections grow, the more points they’re worth when organising Temporary Exhibitions, as well as at the end of the game. But that’s not all. Savvy curators will also need to navigate the upper echelons of society, attracting wealthy patrons, exploiting the ever-changing art market and calling in favours where necessary...
Painting cards are the main component of the game. Each of the 180 cards represents a historical masterpiece, along with the following information:
These cards are shuffled together at the start of the game and split into multiple decks in order to form the Art Market.
The structure of a turn in Museum: Pictura is simple yet players will regularly find themselves confronted with important choices that will determine how their strategy (and Prestige) evolves over the course of a game.

Acquisition phase
The player’s turn starts with the Acquisition phase where new Painting cards are acquired from the Art Market by drawing two cards from any of the decks.
The player must then exchange a Painting card from their hand with one of the four International Museums on the central board. In Pictura, Painting cards have no fixed value. Just like in the real world of art, the value of a piece is subjective and can depend on changing fashions and opinions, which is where Trend cards come in. These are used in multiple instances throughout the game, but in this case each of the four museums is attributed their own Trend card randomly during setup. This card represents what kind of Paintings that establishment is looking for.
Trend cards assign a value -in Prestige points- to a certain Period (header colour), Style (icon) and Artist (number). When exchanging paintings you place a Painting card from your hand into an International Museum of your choice before taking another one from them. If you give them a Painting card with criteria present on their Trend card, you’ll gain Prestige. If you take a painting card with one of those criteria though, you’ll lose Prestige points.
Once the active player has performed their mandatory exchange, each of the other players may also exchange a card if they so wish.
It’s up to players to navigate this constantly changing pool of available Painting cards, exchanging paintings so as to strike a balance between gaining Prestige and acquiring paintings that best suit their strategy.

Action Phase
Once they have acquired their new cards, players may perform one of these three actions:
Exhibit Paintings
The core of Museum: Pictura, and your main source of Prestige, are the Collections of paintings that you’ll be building within the halls of your establishment.
Each player has their own Museum board, onto which they’ll be arranging their Painting cards. In order to exhibit a card, you simply discard any other card from your hand to pay for it. Discarded cards can be recovered by performing an Inventory action. However, cards in your Discard pile can be taken by other players, so pay attention to what you discard!
Exhibited cards can then be arranged to form collections of Periods or Styles. The bigger these collections get, the more Prestige points they’re worth.

Exhibiting a card into your museum doesn’t earn points. However, there is a Public Trend card that changes each round and represents the public’s current preference. If you exhibit a card with one of the criteria shown on that Trend card, you will gain Prestige points!

Perform an Inventory
If your Hand is getting a little sparse, you may decide to perform an Inventory during your turn instead of placing cards. This allows you to take cards back from your Discard pile into your Hand. This is great way to replenish your Hand and prevent your opponents from getting your discarded cards!

It also allows you to draw a Favour card and refresh the Patron cards currently on the board.
Even though this action doesn’t (directly) earn you any Prestige, it is great for managing your Discard pile and getting back into the game with fresh resources.

Organise a Temporary Exhibition
The final type of action a player can take is to organise a Temporary Exhibition. In Pictura, your museum is always open to the public but you can organise special events, galas and private viewings which take the form of Temporary Exhibitions. When you perform this action you get to score one of your current collections. This will earn you Prestige as well as the advantages of one of six bonus abilities shown on your player board which can come into effect during or at the end of the game.
However, each player can only do a Temporary Exhibition for each Period or Style once during the game. Additionally, the first player to organise an event for a Period or Style scores bonus Prestige points to represent their visitors’ enthusiasm for something new! The next person to organise an Exhibition on that theme still scores that collection but gains no bonus points. However, after the second one, the public will lose interest and no more Temporary Exhibitions of that type can be organised.
This lends a timing element to these events - they can represent a lot of Prestige points but waiting until your collections reach optimal sizes could leave you without a public that’s interested in them!

Free actions
On top of performing one of the three mandatory actions, a player can also perform the following free actions during their turn:
Call in a Favour
Favour cards are one shot ability cards with a variety of effects. You start the game with one and can play one during each of your turns. More Favour cards can be acquired by gaining more Prestige, as well as performing other actions.

 Acquire new Patrons 
During a game of Museum: Pictura, you’ll be able to gain additional Prestige by attracting the attention of influential Patrons! The Patron board will show what they’re looking for. If you have the Paintings requested by one of these Patron cards exhibited in your Museum, they’ll reward you!

Once they’ve performed their actions, the turn is passed to the next player and so on and so forth until someone reaches 50 or more prestige points.
The end of the game is set off when any player reaches 50 or more Prestige. They finish their turn and then each other player has one more turn before moving on to final scoring.
To the Prestige they’ve earned during the game players will also be adding the values of the collection in their museums, bonuses from their personal Trend cards which are chosen at the start of the game as well as points from your temporary Exhibitions and rewards for filling out your galleries.
Players will also lose points if they have too many cards in their Discard pile, so managing it correctly during the game is important.
The player with the most Prestige points at the end of the game, wins!
You can find the full rulebook here
We also have a rules and playthrough video:
Pictura is part of the Museum “range”. Despite having certain mechanics and contents that harken back to its predecessor in a recognisable way, it has always been designed to be its own game with the goal of providing a fresh new set collection experience and not simply being an “improved” or “more recent” version of the original game.
Therefore, despite its familiar appearance there are some significant differences from the original. You may have picked up on some of them whilst reading through this page but if you’d like to know about all the new elements, then we’ve prepared a video just for you!
 Don’t have time to watch the video? Here are the main differences in a nutshell:
-          The cards: Painting cards in Pictura work differently to the Object cards in the original Museum. They don’t have individual values, so to place a card in your museum, you simply discard any other card, 1 for 1.
-          Scoring Points: The way you score points during the game is completely different. In Pictura, you have a far greater variety of ways to score (and lose!) points during the game, from following Trend cards to organising Temporary Exhibitions and attracting Patrons. This gives you a lot more opportunities to consider during the game.
-          The importance of timing: Although the original Museum had a certain element of timing to it, choosing the right time to perform certain actions in Museum: Pictura is incredibly important! Organising a Temporary Exhibition at the perfect moment can truly be a game changer. Keeping an eye on a fellow curator whose score is creeping perilously close to 50 is crucial too…
-          Optimising your Collections: Thanks to Temporary Exhibitions and your personal Trend card, it’s possible to score a Collection more than once in Museum: Pictura. You’ll need to plan your collections carefully to squeeze out every last Prestige point from the cards you place!
-          Managing your Discard: In Museum: Pictura, managing your Discard is more important than ever before! Contrary to the first game, once a card has been discarded, performing an Inventory is the only way to get it back. On top of that, every card in your discard will lose you points at the end of the game, which can add up to a lot if you don’t stay on top of it!

Pictura has been in development since early 2019. After a studious research phase spent identifying all the paintings we wanted to have appear in the game we began testing the game extensively as the mammoth task of illustrating all the game’s contents got underway.
Fast forward to 2020 and we have a game that is fully illustrated and tested. All other content shown during this campaign is also basically finished, some graphic and balancing tasks outstanding.
Apart from making some material upgrades, we’ll be using the same manufacturer as the first Museum. With them having handled the original game, the pre-production and manufacturing Pictura should be a very smooth process.
Shipping costs are not included in your pledge. We have however done our best to keep the costs as low as possible. After the campaign has concluded we will ask you to pay for shipping during the "Pledge Manager" phase.

Risks and challenges
EXPERIENCE

This is not our first Kickstarter. This is HGG's eighth project so we are very familiar with the running and fulfilment of a KS project as well as where to look for any potential pitfalls. We currently have two other ongoing Kickstarter projects: Titan, and Museum Deluxe Version. Both are currently in pre-production. We are active on both pages, providing regular updates, answering questions and generally keeping our backers informed at each stage of the project.

DELIVERY DATE

We're estimating a March 2021 delivery date. This corresponds to the time we believe will be necessary to prepare the game for manufacturing, produce it and ship it to you. It also includes a safety margin too in case we come across any unforeseen circumstances.
It is in our best interests to get the game to our backers as soon as possible and we will do our utmost to deliver before this date and/or ensure that there are no delays. However, it may be that a situation arises that is out of our control, such as issues with shipping, customs or problems at the factory. Should anything cause this date to change we will of course keep you updated.

REFUND POLICY

All pledges can be refunded -minus KS and Strype fees (10%)- up until the closing date of the Pledge Manager, no questions asked. After that date we will not be able to process refunds.
If, for any reason, we are unable to produce the game we will provide a full refund to all our backers.

BEHAVIOUR

We always welcome feedback and constructive criticism of our projects and games. However, we will not tolerate the abuse or harassment of HGG, it's staff or other participants of this Kickstarter. HGG reserves the right to refund and remove any person found in violation of these standards.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

Any costs shown in $ are based on the exchange rate in effect during the first day of the campaign.
By pledging to this Kickstarter, you acknowledge that the final appearance, materials and content of the rewards are subject to change and may differ from what is presented whilst the Kickstarter project is active.

You agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other costs that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods.

updates.update_content:
Hi there Curators!

It’s official: we’re in production, hooray! Production is now well under way, and the factory have started with the trickiest (and most time-consuming) components: the wooden tokens and cards sleeves.
The tokens are looking great:

Greetings Curators,

We’re happy to finally announce that Pictura is going to print! Printing should be underway by early next week. Once again, you all have our thanks for your patience and understanding over these past few months. It’s been tricky on the manufacturing side of things but we’re happy to finally see the light at the end of the tunnel.

This also means that we can give you an approximate timetable for delivery. The factory has given us an estimation of 45-60 days for production. On top of that we’re looking at around 30-45 days for freight shipping and customs for a total of 75-105 days until we can start getting your games shipped out to you.

Hi there Curators,

Our apologies for publishing this update a little later than epected, we were waiting for the factory sample of Pictura to arrive!

It finally got here on Friday, so after the long Easter weekend, we’ve spent the past few days going through it with a fine-tooth comb. We couldn’t be happier with the result!

Greetings Curators!

I’m afraid that we don’t have much to report with this update as our factory partners have been on holiday for the past few weeks for the Lunar New Year.

We received the digital printings of the game and took the time to go through everything to catch any final mistakes and the files are now finalized.

Greetings Curators,

First of all, a Happy New Year and our best wishes to all of you for 2021! The team is back from their holiday break and we’d like to kick off this year with a comprehensive update for you.

Greetings curators !

First, and most importantly : 

The PM will now be closing next Monday (30th of November). We noticed that some of you still haven’t filled in your pledge manager, so just in case anyone was waiting until the eleventh hour to make any changes, now is your final chance.



Next up:

Greetings Curators,

A fairly short update for you today.

Files and Rulebooks

Greetings Curators,
First of all, apologies for the wait for this update. As you all know we try to publish something at least every month but between the summer break and getting everything back up to speed, this one is arriving a bit late.
What we have to talk to you about today is a bit unusual as it doesn’t concern Pictura alone but actually the Museum range.

Greetings Curators,
I hope that you are all safe and well. This will be quite a brief update, as I’m afraid that for the moment, we don’t have a lot to show you.
Since the end of the Covid19 quarantine here in France, we've been working hard to catch up on the considerable amount of time we lost, and taking stock of how our projects have been affected. We want to take this opportunity to let you know how we’re doing and give you full transparency on how we’re currently managing our production schedule.

campaign.story:
Ancient teleport spells and alcohol do not mix...
A late-night "research" session has opened a portal to unknown realms. From that portal leaps Pooky's evil doppelganger, ready to wreak havoc in our heroes' beloved tavern!
Unlike his kinder, gentler (although still somewhat chaotic) namesake, this Pooky is evil right to the core. Our heroes will have their hands full with this harmful little bunny and his otherworldly doppelgangers.
Evil Pooky is the 50th character in our long-running Red Dragon Inn series, so we've really pulled out all the stops for this one. The retail version of this game has a bunch of great stuff, and the editions you can get through this campaign just get better from there!
The Red Dragon Inn is a game for 2 or more players with each player taking on the role of a heroic adventurer (or sometimes a dastardly villain) in a wild free-for-all party at a fantasy tavern. Brawl, drink and gamble the night away to prove your mettle and be the last player standing at the end of an evening of bad decision making. Will you be able to outplay your opponents? Or will you wake up the next morning with a throbbing headache, a bit less gold in your pocket, and a horse awkwardly nudging you out of his stall?
If this is your first time joining us, we suggest you check out our introduction to The Red Dragon Inn. And if you're new to the game, we have two pledge levels just for you: the Newcomer Edition and the Newcomer Collector's Edition. These include the new Evil Pooky product, the original Pooky, and the original Red Dragon Inn game. With either of the Newcomer editions, you will have everything you need for a six player game!
But let's not get ahead of ourselves. Here are the editions available through this campaign:
The basic edition contains (of course) the Evil Pooky character deck and side deck, plus his Boss Battle deck (he is a villain, after all - check out the Boss Battle rules on page 13 of this document). It also contains a complete 30-card Drink Deck with some old classics from the history of RDI, plus eight new ones. It also contains two promo Prize Cards for use in the Prize Variant we introduced a couple of years ago. (Stay tuned for the update about these!)
And as a fun bonus, we've also decided to include something a little zany: Epic Pooky - a Boss Battle deck for the original Pooky! Yes, now you can play Pooky himself as the Boss in a Boss Battle! You could even play Epic Pooky vs Boss Evil Pooky in a Boss Showdown Royale!
As with most of our campaigns, all content in this game is unlocked on day 1. No need to hit a bunch of arbitrary stretch goals to get the game to have a good contents list - it already has that. However, to keep engagement high, we will be doing a bunch of updates with drink card reveals, so stay tuned!
For the Collector's Edition, we're going super heavy on the pimped-out swag.
First, there are two additional brand-new promo Prize Cards for use in the Prize Variant. (Again, to be revealed later!)
Next, some plastic bits. Have you ever wanted fancier, more tactile Fortitude and Alcohol Content Markers? Us too. This project will have them - molded plastic pieces sized to the numbers on your player mats! The Collector's Edition comes with 6 of each, and you can add more packs of 6 of each to your pledge by overpledging $12 per extra pack you'd like. 
Base diameter approx. half an inch
In addition, there will also be a plastic Pooky Mood Marker!
Approx. 1 inch tall
So you get all of this:
Crude rendering of awesome plastic bits!
But, you may be asking, what good is a plastic marker if you don't have the original Pooky deck? Well, the Collector's Edition will include a holographic foil reprint of the original Pooky deck. Pooky has always been a fan favorite, so we decided to swag out his deck. And while we're on the subject of holographic foil cards...
... ALL cards in the Collector's Edition will come in BOTH holographic foil and non-foil versions. Yes, you read that correctly. ALL of them. The Evil Pooky character deck, the Evil Pooky Boss deck, the original Pooky deck, the Boss deck for original Pooky, the Drink deck, the promo cards, everything. So now you can blind your opponents not only with the brilliance of your plays, but also with the shininess of your cards!
(Note that adding non-foil versions was a change that we made post-launch, so we are not allowed to change the items listed in the pledge level. Please see our update for more information.)
There are two pledge levels for folks new to The Red Dragon Inn: the Newcomer Edition and the Newcomer Collector's Edition. The Newcomer Edition is the Retail Edition, plus a copy of the original Red Dragon Inn game, plus a copy of the original Pooky expansion. The Newcomer Collector's Edition is the Collector's Edition, plus a copy of the original Red Dragon Inn game. (Remember, the Collector's Edition already includes the original Pooky!)
The Newcomer Editions give you everything you need for a game of up to six players, so either one is a perfect entry-level pledge if you'd like to dip your toe into the RDI waters!
If you'd like to go "Red Dragon All In", we have just the pledge level for you. The Ultimate Edition starts with the pimped-out Collector's Edition and adds all of the other RDI games as well. You get RDI 1-7, all of the RDI: Allies, the Smorgasbox, Battle for Greyport and its Pirates expansion, and even our Pathfinder supplement, The Red Dragon Inn Guide to Inns and Taverns.
Yes, you get all 50 RDI characters with the Ultimate Edition. But that's not all!
From our merch store, you'll get a metal coin set, plus your choice of any character t-shirt.
Finally, the ultimate piece of our Ultimate Edition is 20 copies, plus an art print, of a drink or prize card of your own design! You design a card, we art it, and you get copies to distribute to all of your RDI-playing friends!
 Backers from the US: Packages will be shipped from within the US. If you would like additional copies of the game added to your reward, simply over-pledge in $25 or $57 increments for each extra copy of Evil Pooky you want to add to your rewards. You can add any number of additional copies to your rewards and you need only pay shipping once.
 International Backers: Where possible, we will try to use regional shipping options. However, where that is not possible you may be responsible for your country's import duties or fees. Note that this includes Canada. We do not guarantee "friendly" shipping to any country other than the US for this project.
Furthermore, we want to make it absolutely clear that there will be no pledge manager for this campaign. Backers will not have the opportunity to upgrade their pledge level after the end of the campaign and should pledge what they want during the funding period. Backers will receive a survey via Kickstarter to provide their shipping information a few weeks before we begin the fulfillment process. It is your responsibility to fill out this Kickstarter survey in a timely fashion if you want to receive your rewards by our predicted delivery date.
Finally, if you would like to review the SlugFest Games Kickstarter Policy, you can find it on our website here.
As with most of our campaigns, we are not using a post-campaign pledge manager. However, if you want to pick up another RDI game to go with the cool stuff in this product, you can head to our web store,  where you can pick up any of our products without having to wait for your backer rewards to ship! During the campaign, we are offering free US shipping on all of our games, as well as our fancy metal coin sets. (Sorry, but our other specialty merch still requires shipping charges!)
If you'd like to try Evil Pooky or some of our upcoming semi-sorta-secret stuff, then you should join the SlugFest Games Digital Play Test Community today! All you need to participate is a microphone for chat, Discord and Tabletop Simulator. We host daily sessions and would love to see you come by and give our stuff a test drive.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We pride ourselves in our ability to deliver a quality product on time, and we stand by our track record of doing so. We know how to run a Kickstarter project, and when there are problems, we fix them. However, here's a list of things you should know that could possibly go wrong:

1. Development Delay: Development on this project is nearly done! The only delay that could come here is if we notice something really bad in playtest that we didn't see before.

2. Manufacturing Delay: We have a great relationship with our manufacturers and they work hard to get us our stuff on schedule. However, as always, unforeseen problems can arise, such as the situation happening right now with the spread of the Coronavirus.

3. Shipping Delay: Sometimes your stuff just goes missing and we have to print everything all over again. True story: an entire shipping container of our games was stolen back in July of 2012. Seriously.

4. Customs Delay: We have no control over the border policies of any country we import games into (including the US). Sometimes games get held up at a border - sometimes for a bafflingly long time.

5. Extraterrestrials could invade and enslave us to their will, and they may not be tabletop gamers.

The good news is that this is not our first rodeo by a LONG shot. We have launched and delivered on multiple campaigns much to the satisfaction of our backers. We have padded our promised delivery date with all of the realistic delays in mind so you can confidently expect your game to arrive by our suggested delivery date.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone. We're happy to report that at this point, everything should now be shipped out and in your hands.
The flipside of this, though, is that if you haven't received your product yet, is means that something went wrong with your shipment. If this is the case, please contact us at support@slugfestgames.com.
Thank you all again. We remain honored and grateful that the Red Dragon Inn community continues to support us. Your enthusiasm makes all the cargo freight headaches and manufacturing snafus worth it. And we'll have an announcement about more RDI content soon, so stay tuned!

Hi again, folks. This quick update is to let you know that product has arrived at all fulfillment partners (including US), and fulfillment has begun. We don't control the exact day when our fulfillment partners start to ship, but we've gotten word that at least Canada and non-UK Europe are underway. Other regions are expected to start soon, and we'll keep you informed of progress. Thanks!

Hello, backers. We have a bit more information to share with you today about reward fulfillment. We can confirm that the product is now (finally) on the ocean on its way to the US, and is scheduled to get to the US on Nov 27, which means that it should be in our warehouse by the first week of December. This means that we still think that we're probably on track to make our stated deadline of the end of December.

However, after several updates where we've called attention to that fact, it would be completely reasonable for you to think that we're a little nervous about that deadline... because we are. We think that there's a chance that some backers may end up getting their product in early January, after our stated deadline. We plan to do everything we can to avoid this, but unfortunately there is at least one piece of the process that could cause trouble - clearing customs. That's a process that is out of our hands. Usually, it only takes a few days. Rarely, it takes several weeks for no apparent reason.
Hi everyone! We've launched a new kickstarter campaign today! It's for a tile-drafting "light euro" game called Dungeon Decorators, and we think you'll love it!

Hi again, backers! As you may have seen earlier today from Kickstarter, now is your last chance to edit your address for your backer rewards. When Kickstarter stops allowing address edits, the only way to edit your address will be to email us directly at support@slugfestgames.com. Changing your address after Kickstarter's deadline could delay your rewards, but we'll still do everything we can to avoid that.

Product is scheduled to leave China soon and begin its journey across the ocean and to various regional shippers. Our best guess is that backers will begin receiving rewards in about 7 or 8 weeks. Please be aware that this is still an educated guess, however. International freight has had a bit of trouble recently,  but seems to be getting back to normal. As usual, if issues arise, we'll keep you informed.

campaign.story:
GoDice is the “Kindle” of board games - A slick, compact and cool (physical) connected dice set, with TONS of quality content for everyone: family games, bar games, educational games, fun games, and so much more.
The data from the GoDice syncs immediately to the app. Make your moves , tap your decisions, and watch the score rise in real time. Papers, score sheets and writing are replaced with a cool digital experience! Complex RPG calculations (multiple dice and battles) are done instantly and automatically -  So you can enjoy the fun, luck, and strategic elements of the games.
GoDice transforms screens into a fun and social "board" game!  It turns screen time into quality time.  Play with your friends online, or round up a group of friends and family to get started (when screens are involved, the younger generation will gladly join the party). GoDice brings people to play TOGETHER. 
The internal sensors enable accurate orientation measurements and real-time sync with the application. By that, more advanced and complex (polyhedral) dice shapes can be configured and tracked using the same GoDice's die.
Such dice are commonly used in many board games, Role Playing Games (DnD etc.), Math games etc. Now with GoDice (and its open API), creators can "dress up" the dice, configure it, and connect to their own applications.
PLAY

GoDice comes with customized designed shells of D20 and D24 (Dice with 20 and 24 faces)! These two generic shapes cover ALL common dice set.
Let your imagination run and let GoDice do the calculating. Focus on how to beat those monsters instead of trying to sum up 12+14+6+3+5+3 +...
PLAY



GoDice is the Kindle of board games, the Tesla of Role Playing Games. It’s a bundle of tons of quality content for everyone: family games, bar games, educational games, and Role Playing Games 
The app comes, out-of-the-box, with many games as well as an open API, so you can employ GoDice for any imaginable game, or even create any game you can imagine.   
GoDice app includes the most popular dice games. The app is what elevates the games from an out of touch old timey idea into the 2010’s, enticing the younger generation to participate and engage
Yatzy is one of the most popular dice games in the world. With more than 100 million players, it's guaranteed fun time with friends and family. GoDice takes Yatzy to the next level with interactive gameplay. It even gives you tips on how to become a better player.
The classic poker dice game is now connected. The 5 smart dice simulate a playing-card deck (top six cards). Each player strives to get the best hand, while GoDice keeps track of your scores. May the flop be with you!
Farkle, also known as 5,000, 10,000, Zilch, and many more names, is a well-loved dice game. It's fun, fast-paced and utilizes math and probability skills- making it a perfect game to play with friends and family. *Only available in 6-dice packs*
A game once played by kings, Ludo is 1500 years old game. It's a strategy board game that will now become a Game-Night favorite for you and your kids. *Only available in 6-dice packs*  

Get information like: trend score overtime, average score, games win and losses, game time, power of your toss and number of turns 
Get tips on how to optimize your gameplay. Which dice should you keep? Which dice should you throw? What category should you choose? How can you increase your chances of winning? GoDice will help you make smarter decisions!.  
Create as many groups as you’d like, and switch between them- the GoDice app will keep track of all your different stats. Whether you play a quick game of Yatzy at your oﬃce or enjoy a game night with your family, the app will track your stats for each group at any time.      
 The GoDice silky and compact carrying case doubles as a supercapacitor charging station. It weighs only 28 grams, and supports ultra-fast charging. 10 seconds charge time = 1 hour of gameplay
GoDice cup
The GoDice compact and versatile stand will conveniently prop up any phone or tablet (no matter the make or model) to make your game night even more enjoyable. Use the GoDice cup for easy rolling, you will quickly find out that the noise the dice make inside this cup is part of the fun and you will not be able to leave it behind…
We’re magic-obsessed problem-solvers who have been putting tiny computers inside tiny devices for quite some time.
In the last few years, we've developed, manufactured and sold a number of smart connected toys worldwide. Last year, we launched GoCube, and finished our crowdfunding campaign with over 11k happy backers and above $1.1M in funding.
After a successful campaign and great feedback from our backers, we've decided to take on a smaller cube: a dice.
We’ve spent the last few months testing and finalizing designs, and we’re thrilled to finally be able to share GoDice with you all :)
100,000,000 people play Yatzy every year, using over a billion papers a year. These are 60,000 trees that could be saved by using GoDice (and that's for Yatzy only). 60,000 TREES per year! GoDice, GoGreen!
PLAY

International Backers: We will ship GoCube worldwide via trackable post. Please note that you may be responsible for duties, handling, fees and taxes applicable to your region, for more info check the FAQ
GoDice is a product of tireless engineering and tweaking by Particula, a company focuses on developing Smart Toys and products, powered by sensors, processing capabilities, ultra-low power and wireless connectivity.
After many long months of trying different setups, finalizing designs, and endless testing, we can not be any prouder to make GoDice available to anyone, anywhere.
We surprised you before with an amazing product, the GoCube, that has earned raving reviews and amazing PR worldwide. We are here to provide you with the same amazing, unforgettable experience, this time with a smaller cube, the dice.

 Tross is a data-driven crowdfunding company

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While there are always risks & challenges with creating and delivering a brand new product, we've minimized both by having the entire process, from production to delivery, already set and arranged.

We have already signed agreements with key suppliers and manufacturers, and our prototype has been finalized. We have the required technical expertise when it comes to the Smart Toys market. In the last four years, our efforts have been focused on developing, manufacturing and selling a wide range of smart connected toys worldwide. We've got some experience under our belts.

All of this, along with our strategic partnerships with experienced crowdfunding and fulfillment experts, leaves little room for error and ensures a very quick delivery.

STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED: 21

In Tiny Epic Dinosaurs, breakthroughs in modern science have dinosaurs and humans existing side by side. This has allowed for a lucrative industry: Dino Ranching! 
Independent ranchers have begun farming dinosaurs to sell to the highest bidders for use in their high thrill theme parks. 
You are one of those ranchers. Do you have what it takes to out ranch your opponents and operate the most successful dinosaur farm!?
Tiny Epic Dinosaurs is a 45 minute, 1-4 player game of dinosaur ranching, worker-placement and resource management. It features classic euro game mechanics with unique twists that portray the dangers of farming these prehistoric beasts.
In Tiny Epic Dinosaurs, players control a team of ranchers and will be acquiring, breeding and selling dinosaurs. The game is played over 6 rounds. With each round consisting of several short phases.
In phase one, players will harvest the resources from their farm that are not being consumed by their dinosaurs.
In phase two, players will put their ranchers to work. This phase has ranchers wrangling and buying new dinosaurs to farm, improving their farm’s security and supplies, vying for high dollar contracts, and researching technologies and unique dinosaur breeds. These unique dinosaur breeds introduce a large variety of special benefits players can utilize to separate themselves from their competition.
In phase three, ranchers return to finish their day’s work at the farm.
In phase four, players arrange their ranch, making sure their ranch is suitable for the types and quantities of dinosaurs they have.
Phase five is the feeding phase, and every dinosaur MUST be fed. Dinosaurs that don’t eat will escape, posing a grave threat to your enclosures’ security and your other dinosaurs.
Phase six is for breeding. For each pair of matching dinosaurs you have properly enclosed, you’ll welcome a new dinosaur to your farm!
At the end of the game, players will receive victory points for each dinosaur they have, public and private contracts they acquired and for their research developments. The player with the most victory points, wins the game.
This image reflects unlocked stretch goals.

Deluxe Content: Laboratory Mini Expansion
The Laboratory Mini Expansion introduces certain rewards to players during play, like extra dinosaurs, resources, or research cards. To unlock these rewards, players follow research paths marked on their Laboratory Mats. 
During setup, and at the start of each round, Lab Tokens are randomly placed above each Action Mat. When a player places a Rancher on an Action Mat, if there is a Lab Token there, that player must follow that research path on their Laboratory Mat. The Lab Token is then discarded. Once a player reaches a reward, they receive it immediately and reset their Microscope Token to the center of the Laboratory Mat.
The Laboratory Mini Expansion adds layers of thinking to a player's strategy when placing their Ranchers to take actions. If a player can synergize their action choices with the research paths they desire on their Laboratory Mat, they can accomplish more with fewer actions putting them ahead of their competition!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game is a highly involved process. It can be prone to many mistakes and delays, even for experienced publishers.

We're proud to say that we are prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully producing board games and fulfilling Kickstarter projects.

Here are the steps we take to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the illustrations for the game complete and the graphic art over 95% complete. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are working with an experienced manufacturing partner. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements and costs for when it comes time for shipping. We will provide tracking information for the boat when the games leave China.

3. We are working with an experienced fulfillment partner. We are confident that they can handle any amount of work we send their way. They have fulfilled many projects and have proven to be communicative, punctual and respectful when dealing with our customers.

Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process and involve our backers as much as possible. I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions and I read every comment. I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress.

Thank you for your trust in us! Let's bring Tiny Epic Dinosaurs to game tables around the world!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
*Game Design & Development*
All game design and development on Sub Terra II is complete, with a final validation round of public playtesting ongoing throughout the campaign. The two expansions are designed and developed and require a last round of playtesting before being complete. We've got one of the most dedicated and talented teams around, and we are more than confident that everything will be complete ready for a timely transition to the next stage of the process as well as being great fun!

*Artworking*
All art assets and all design assets required for the core game are complete, with the majority already ready for print. There's still a couple of bits left for the expansions, and a few sculpts left, all of which is scheduled for completion before the end of the campaign. Diana, Marco, Tim, and Tom are fast, effective and professional and are all dedicated to making this their best project yet on budget and on time.

*Pledge Management*
After the campaign is complete we will launch the backer survey, or 'Pledge Manager'. This will be using the service pledgemanager.com
The Sub Terra II PM page is already in progress, with completion in the next week or so, meaning it'll be ready almost immediately after completion of the campaign. We will leave the PM open until we begin freighting goods around the world from the factory in China. With any complex software platform, there's always the chance of something going wrong or someone making a mistake. We've used this platform for 4 years now, and have direct communication on a daily basis with the PM team to fix bugs on the fly.

*Print Preparation*
All files for the core game without any stretch goals applied are complete and ready for print. expansion and upgrade pack packaging is laid out and ready for final assets. Artwork required is minimal and all print assets are laid out ready for final assets where needed to minimise turnaround time to print.
The ITB team will be visiting Longpack in Shanghai for a site inspection and print preparation session for one to two weeks to ensure the print goes to plan, on time.

*Mass Manufacture*
Longpack games are our manufacturing partner for Sub Terra II and the reprint of Sub Terra. Longpack is an incredibly well-respected printing company based in Shanghai who we've worked with on NewSpeak, Crypt X, and now Sub Terra. They are driven, professional, honest and effective. Importantly they are realistic and open about timelines, giving us the information we need to communicate with you on changes to plans. Mass manufacture of board games is really complex and can be delayed as a result of suppliers, other production projects, machinery breakdown or anything else that can affect a large company like Longpack.
We've made sure that all the stretch goals are pre-planned, costed, communicated with the factory and worked out production-wise to ensure there are no snags.

*Freight & Fulfilment*
International freight can have a deep impact on the timeline, as there are so many factors that determine how long it takes a shipment to get from the factory. We've selected the best logistics partners in the world, who are both knowledgeable about the tabletop industry as well as professional and experienced in international logistics. We have predeveloped plans for freight around the world, with estimates of the proportion of total print to each region to make planning for partners easier. Fulfillment has been planned out with packaging and labeling to be complete by the end of the campaign. Fulfillment planning has taken into account all pledge options, shipping regions, and possible stretch goals' impact on size and weight.

*After-Campaign Care*
We now have a productivity platform that integrates all support emails, accounts emails, project mail, social media and more - meaning we can be far, far quicker and more comprehensive in responding to backer queries and issues. We will also be looking to hire a new customer service assistant as a full-time member of the ITB team should we reach a sufficient number of backers to warrant it, to allow for seamless service.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello Adventurers!
Relatively quick update for you today!
Tooling and sampling is now properly underway for the Core Came, Expansions, and Upgrade Packs - hype! 🥳

updates.update_userinfo: Journey Home: We're on the Case!
updates.update_content:
Hello, Explorers!
At this point, we expected to have digital proofs for everything by now and physical samples for most of the products.

This hasn’t quite happened yet.

Hello Adventurers!
Chinese New Year is over, we’re back in touch with our factory, and it is time for an update!

As I’m sure you all noticed, we had a LOT of print effects unlocked during our amazing campaign. Making sure that all of them are accounted for has been - an experience, to say the least.

Hello Explorers!
A fairly substantial update for you today!
As we’ve mentioned in our previous updates, Sub Terra II spent a fair amount of last year 100% on track for fulfilment in March of this year. We had built in a fair amount of wiggle room with our initial projections, meaning that 2020 didn’t have as much of an effect on our timeline as it could have had.

Hello explorers!
We certainly expected a more substantial update for you by now, but we haven’t heard back from the factory in terms of updating timelines. We’re expecting them to get back to us in the next week, but since we were expecting to hear back from them before the end of January, we wanted to make sure you knew what we were waiting for. As Chinese New Year is coming up quickly (12-26 February), we’re expecting to hear back from them by the end of this week.

Hello Adventurers! Quick Update for today!
As we’re sure some of you have noticed, we’ve recently launched a campaign for our new gamebook, Alba. Things are still moving along with Sub Terra II, and we figured we should give you a quick update.
We’re still churning through all the factory back and forth for the last couple of SKUs, but we’re expecting to have pictures of samples for most of the components by the end of the month!

Hello, Explorers!
Just a quick update for you this month! Our Graphic Designer Liam is hard at work compiling all the files for print so we can send them to the factory to make sure printing is finished ahead of Chinese New Year in February. He’s making great progress, especially given the way the files are saved in the Drive (not particularly consistently, to say the least!).
All this to say, we’re still on track! The only things we’re waiting on right now are some promo artwork and more pages for the Graphic Novel - so exactly where we need to be!

Hey Adventurers!
Just a quick update for you this month!
We’ve been in contact with our factory in the last month to make sure everything’s ready once we get the print files finalized. We’re happy to report that all the supplier factories are now back up and running, so we’re confident that there won’t be any manufacturing delays.

Hello, Explorers!

We are pleased to announce that ALL game content (core games, expansions, and upgrade packs) is officially in and approved!
We’re still waiting on a few of the promos to be completed, but we’re rapidly approaching the finish line and couldn’t be happier with how the game’s turning out!

One is a skilled hunter, the eagle-eyed sniper who never misses a shot. The other is a fearsome werewolf, who is both a formidable villain and a literal party animal.
Presenting: The Red Dragon Inn Allies: Piper vs Ripsnarl!
You've seen these two tangle in Battle for Greyport, our cooperative deckbuilding game, but now they're coming to the tavern to join the party as our 48th and 49th characters for The Red Dragon Inn!
The Red Dragon Inn is a game for 2 or more with each player taking on the role of a heroic adventurer (or sometimes a dastardly villain) in a wild free-for-all party at a fantasy tavern. Brawl, drink and gamble the night away to prove your mettle and be the last player standing at the end of an evening of bad decision making. Will you be able to outplay each of your opponents? Or will you wake up the next morning with a throbbing headache, a bit less gold in your pocket, and a horse awkwardly nudging you out of his stall?
If this is your first time joining us, we suggest you check out our introduction to The Red Dragon Inn. And if you're new to the game, we have two pledge levels just for you: the Newcomer Edition, which includes a copy of the original Red Dragon Inn game, and the Newcomer Collector's Edition, which includes all the fancy swag plus the original Red Dragon Inn game. If you get one of the Newcomer Editions, you will have everything you need for a game of up to six players!
And so, without further, ado...
Here's what you get in the Retail Edition:
In the Collector's Edition, you get several new bits of promo content, including two new Drink Cards, a new Prize Card and a second new Prize "Card" made out of metal! Expect more details about the promo content in a campaign update.

We have some very important information for backers regarding shipping options for the various Pledge Levels. This info is divided into two broad categories of backers:
 Backers from the US: Packages will be shipped from within the US. If you would like additional copies of the game added to your reward, simply over-pledge in $25 or $45 increments for each extra copy of Piper vs. Ripsnarl  you want to add to your rewards. You can add any number of additional copies to your rewards and you need only pay shipping once.
 International Backers: Where possible, we will try to use regional shipping options. However, where that is not possible you may be responsible for your country's import duties or fees. Note that this includes Canada. We do not guarantee "friendly" shipping to any country other than the US for this project.
Furthermore, we want to make it absolutely clear that there will be no pledge manager for this campaign. Backers will not have the opportunity to upgrade their pledge level after the end of the campaign and should pledge what they want during the funding period. Backers will receive a survey via Kickstarter to provide their  shipping information a few weeks before we begin the fulfillment  process. It is the backer's responsibility to fill out this Kickstarter survey in a timely fashion if they want to receive their rewards by our predicted delivery date.
Finally, if you would like to review the SlugFest Games Kickstarter Policy, you can find it on our website here.

However, if you want to pick up another RDI game to go with the cool stuff in this product, you can head to our web store, where you can pick up any of our products without having to wait for your allies to ship! We've done substantial playtesting on all of the stuff in this product, but if you'd like to try one of the new characters or have a look at some of our upcoming semi-sorta-secret stuff, then you should join the SlugFest Games Digital Play Test Community today! campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We pride ourselves in our ability to deliver a quality product on time, and we stand by our track record of doing so. However, here's a list of things you should know that could possibly go wrong:

1. Development Delay: Development on this project is nearly done! The only delay that could come here is if we notice something bad that we didn't see before.

2. Manufacturing Delay: We have a great relationship with our manufacturers and they work hard to get us our stuff on schedule. However, as always, unforeseen problems can arise.

3. Shipping Delay: Sometimes your stuff just goes missing and we have to print everything all over again. True story: an entire shipping container of our games was stolen back in July of 2012. Seriously.

4. Customs Delay: We have no control over the border policies of any country we import games into (including the US). Sometimes games get held up at a border - sometimes for a bafflingly long time.

5. Extraterrestrials could invade and enslave us to their will, and they may not be tabletop gamers.

The good news is that this is not our first rodeo by a LONG shot. We have launched and delivered on multiple campaigns much to the satisfaction of our backers. We have padded our promised delivery date with all of the realistic delays in mind so you can confidently expect your game to arrive by our suggested delivery date.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
It's Extra Life season!
For years we've been supporting streamers who play our games for charity, and this year we decided to get in on the action ourselves! On Saturday, November 9 from noon to 6 PM Pacific time (UTC -8), we'll be heading to Twitch to stream ourselves playing games, talking about SlugFest, and chatting with a few special guests.
And at 5 PM, toward the end of that stream, we'll be announcing the 50th Red Dragon Inn character! You won't want to miss it. Trust us.  :-)

And just like that, we come to the end of another campaign - one that beat the total funding level of each of our previous Allies campaigns. Every time we start to think that maybe the RDI series has run its course and can't possibly maintain fans' enthusiasm, we get another great boost of support from you folks. It's awesome, and inspiring.
All that's left now is to make the product - and our print files are almost done and ready to be sent to manufacturing. Stay tuned for news of our progress!
Gog would like to remind you that there's only one day left to back the Piper vs Ripsnarl campaign!

Like some of our recent two-character sets, this one is a "vs" set, which means that it contains a hero and a villain. Long-time RDI fans know that the moniker of "villain" means more than just flavor. Since their introduction in RDI 6, villains not only have a thematic "bad guy" vibe to them - they can also be played in a Boss Battle!
The Boss Battle variant (found on pg 13 of the linked rules doc) is a play mode that allows one player to pilot a villain's "boss mode" with an improved deck that would be quite overpowered in an individual game. However, they must face off against 2, 3 or 4 other players who are playing normal decks and ganging up on the boss!

campaign.story:
Sleep House
When the planet's resources are no longer enough, 20% of the population must be "optimized". But will Rasha avoid the Sleep House?
Silent Eye - Episode 5
We started filming Silent Eye in early 2018. Each episode is a self contained short story set in the near future.
Episode 5 will focus on an environmental theme. With the living conditions of our planet in an increasingly poor state, the Silent Eye team have developed the next episode to reflect on a disturbing vision of the future, if we as a species continue acting as we are.
At the same time, we feel this is a strong episode narrative which confronts the issue, without ever becoming a "message" story. This episode doesn't preach to anyone, or pointing the finger of blame.
This story addresses the dilemma we face as a species. Aside from that, it's a very personal, emotional tale about a woman (RASHA), who is a wife and a mother of 2 small children.
To help save the planet, she faces the horrifying prospect of losing her future with her family. And this story is about her coming to terms with the sacrifice she is asked to make.
But there is still a chance she may escape the Sleep House... 
What is Silent Eye?
Silent Eye is a science fiction TV show shot with smartphones. Each episode contains a new story with new characters. The series is currently available via Amazon in the USA, UK and Germany.  
In the last 4 weeks, Silent Eye has been watched on Amazon Prime for 1.7 million minutes. That's the equivalent of 113,469 episodes.
Rewards
As this episode is about preserving the planet's resources, it's only right that we try to do that as well. For that reason, all the rewards for this episode are digital so we don't have to cut down any trees to send postcards or other items.
But have a look and see if what we are offering appeals. Of course, we always fully appreciate all support at any level. 
It's YOU who made this show possible!
Cast & Crew
For this episode David (Callum in Episode 2 and co-producer of the following episodes) will be directing. Meanwhile, I will be focusing on getting the best out of my Samsung S9 + FiLMiC Pro.
We also have some exciting and highly talented cast on board!
Playing RASHA will be Sophie Brooke, who is a fantastic actress, previously playing roles in a number of Channel 4 productions, such as FLOWERS and UNSPEAKABLE.
Playing her husband FARMEN will be the fantastically talented Loui Bernard.
For crew we will have the brilliant Barnaby Hall back on sound. We will also have the great Brian Vowles working on our CGI for us. You might know about Brian's brilliant self-made scifi epic Robot Attack.
If you haven't seen it yet, check it out below.
Location
For Episode 5 we will be filming in Switzerland! Since smartphone film fest MoMo was established 5 years ago we have held the festival in Switzerland every year. But this will be the first time we shoot an episode in this beautiful country.
What the Eye Has Revealed So Far...
In You Have Been Chosen, Fiona downloads an app which promises to make better life decisions for her.
In ReGen, a group of people are driven to extraordinary lengths to survive using a serum which brings people back from the dead.
In The Unlocking Thought, an inventor a system which makes people happy struggles to find happiness himself.
In The Museum of Me a successful entrepreneur is surprised to find he and his wife have been invited to the opening of a museum exhibition… all about himself.

campaign.story:
Successors is one of the best multiplayer strategy games ever published (previous editions by Avalon Hill in 1997 and GMT Games in 2008). Designed by the legendary Richard H. Berg, Mark Simonitch, and John B. Firer, Successors brings you the  best of this kind of game: tense and ruthless gameplay in a world of ever-changing alliances. 
The development team at PHALANX has given this game a careful, meticulous update. It is now more accessible and easier to play. It contains gorgeous miniatures. It has received new, stunning art. It is even better than it used to be.
Join us to publish the Fourth Edition of this splendid game together!
 What do the players say? 
What’s in the box?
During the campaign we have unlocked 26 stretch goals. All of these items will be added to each SUCCESSORS game for free! 
Other pledge levels
20th Anniversary Edition of Mark Simonitch’s Hannibal & Hamilcar, winner of the Golden Geek award for the Best Wargame of 2018, sold out early this year. The game is going to be reprinted in 2020 in an updated version, containing a bigger box and rewritten rules. There will be also available an upgrade pack for the owners of the previous edition. These items are available for pre-order during this Kickstarter campaign. 
If you already own Hannibal & Hamilcar, consider choosing the £80 pledge to get the Upgrade Pack.
If you do not own Hannibal & Hamilcar, choose the £130 pledge to get the bundle of the best ancient war games ever published! 
Please note that £80 and £130 pledges are English edition only. But you will be able to choose French or Spanish edition of Hannibal & Hamilcar as an add-on to your SUCCESSORS Pledge in the pledge manager.  
SUCCESSORS 
Immerse yourself in one of the best multiplayer strategy games ever published. Take part in the conflict between the titular diadochi – Successors – to the legacy and empire of Alexander the Great. Clash with your former brothers in arms turned enemies to gain control of provinces in order to increase the number of your Victory Points or pull appropriate strings to secure the Legitimacy Points (e.g., by providing Alexander’s tomb with a suitable resting place). But beware, too many Victory Points with respect to other players and you will end up having the esteem of a Usurper who could be attacked freely by everyone. Therefore, choose your strategy wisely. It sometimes is more profitable to bide your time because every aspect of the game is intertwined and the sudden turn of events may surprise you with the most unfortunate outcome. For instance, you might be forced to take sides with someone who stabbed you in the back a couple of rounds earlier. However, as they must have said even in 4th Century B.C., the end justifies the means. Especially, when succession is at stake. 
The fourth edition of this card-driven, point-to-point movement strategy is undergoing  a plethora of upgrades that will make it stand out among similarly themed games. It also pays homage to its past editions released by Avalon Hill and GMT Games, respectively. A new, improved layout of the board, charts, and cards, a rewritten and updated rulebook, an introduction to historical scenarios that streamline the gameplay and shorten game sessions, etc. The icing on the cake is its graphic design – a state-of-the-art map board based on an original art by Mark Simonitch, over 60 outstanding illustrations inspired by historical sources, and 12 large 40 mm plastic leader miniatures. All of these make the game a pleasure to watch and even more pleasurable to play. 
So prepare your armies to buckle down, sharpen the blade of your tactical sixth sense, and whet your appetite for claiming your right to Alexander’s throne, for Heaven cannot brook two Suns, nor Earth two masters. There can only be one true Successor! 
Reviews
Game Rules
Please click here to read the rulebook (beta version).
Why pledge now?
To save 20% off the MSRP! After the campaign, the Manufacturers Suggested Retail Price of Successors will be set at £80 ($100, €90).
To get the Kickstarter Exclusive Usurper's Ring expansion for free, worth £8.00 ($10, €9). This item won’t be available in retail distribution.
To get the newest edition of the acclaimed Mark Simonitch’s HANNIBAL & HAMILCAR board game with Expansions or an Upgrade Pack to your former edition of this title.
To receive the game before it hits retail distribution.
To help an independent publisher to design, develop, and publish unique, challenging games!
  Our Goal
This is a simple, straightforward campaign. The design is complete, with more than 22 years of development and playtesting behind it. So, there will be no rule-changing expansions or stretch goals. We will use stretch goals only to improve the game components and add some variants that were created by players since the first edition was published. We offer a great product for a great price and a short fulfillment period. There is no hidden agenda. We offer a great and simple deal.
Estimated delivery for the game is October 2020.

Production and Delivery
Please note that the graphic materials and miniature sculpts presented here are not yet final and may be changed. The photos are of handmade prototypes of the game. The final production quality will be much, much higher.
The games are produced in the EU, in keeping with the proven high standards of PHALANX. If you back us on Kickstarter, you will receive your copy several weeks before the game reaches any retail outlets! Our goal is to produce Successors within 300 days of reaching our funding goal. Kickstarter backers will have their copies delivered no later than October 2020.
Shipping
You will be asked to pay the shipping cost in the Pledge Manager after the campaign. At that time, you will be able to add extra copies of the game and items from our add-on list. Additional items may increase shipping costs. PHALANX is responsible for shipping the English, German and Polish editions of the game. The games will be shipped from the EU using FedEx air freight, so the delivery date will be close to the production date. The estimated shipping cost is: USA £15 to most states, £30 to Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico. Canada £20. EU £12 to most countries (Poland - free). Other European countries £15 - £30. Asia £30, Australia £25, New Zealand £25, Oceania £35, Latin America £35, Africa £35.
You can multiply the chosen Pledge to get significant savings on shipping costs. For example: the cost of shipping to most EU countries will be £12 for a single game and £16-18 for 2-4 games, if shipped to the same address. Call your friends and save around £25 on shipping!
International Distribution
If you're a retailer, please contact us at sales[at]vertima.trade to receive an offer.
Media
Backing the game is a great way to support the project, but the next best thing you could do is to help us create awareness for the game by following us and sharing our posts on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and elsewhere.
Please subscribe to our newsletter (https://phalanxgames.co.uk/contact.html) to be the first to know about our future releases.
The Media Pack is here.

Please read the information on this page carefully and back the game only if you are sure that you want to receive it. We are sure that you won’t regret it, as our previous projects have received great feedback from the community. Nevertheless, sometimes life is not as good as it should be and you will need a refund. In such cases we will refund your pledge, but reduced by 15% fees that we are obliged to pay (Kickstarter, Stripe, PayPal and BackerKit fees).
Who we are
PHALANX is an international publisher, known for great quality products and customer-focused service. We work with renowned designers and help publish great classics (Mark Simonitch’s Hannibal & Hamilcar, Martin Wallace’s Nanty Narking). At the same time, we strive to identify and promote new names behind the games and help people live their dreams via publishing their labour of love projects. We at PHALANX just love games.
ASYNCRON games is a French board game publisher. Its most famous boardgames are Mare Nostrum and FIEF. PHALANX and ASYNCRON games are partners since several years with 1944 RttR, Mare Nostrum, Hannibal & Hamilcar, and U-BOOT The Boardgame. Ediciones MasQueOca has a strategic alliance with Phalanx.
Fox in the Box is a small publishing company which specializes in publishing of heavy games and wargames for Czech and Slovak market. Published games are for example ROOT from Leder Games and Pax Renaissance, John Company, Greenland, and BIOS series from Sierra Madre Games. Also with well known designer of 18XX games Leonhard Orgler they ran together succesfull Kickstarter campaings for 18CZ, 1824 and 18Lilliput which are published worldwide. Please follow this link for Czech language description of the game.
Pendragon Game Studio has been founded in 2014 by a group of Italian  hobby market professionals with more than two decades of experience,  with the mission of creating new games for the international market and  localize great games for the Italian market, as This war of Mine,  Tokaido, First Martians, Detective, Imperial Settlers and many others.  Pendragon team is the people behind Aye, Dark Overlord, Stay Away, Last  Friday, Last Aurora (funded on Kickstarter last July) and other  successful games.
Hexy Studio is a creative team specializing in making board games, animations, high quality 3D models and artwork. They have cooperated with PHALANX on numerous previous projects, including HANNIBAL & HAMILCAR, Nanty Narking and others. For SUCCESSORS, Hexy Studio has created the trailer video and all miniature sculpts.

Risks and challenges
PHALANX has been publishing board games since 2009. 
Our products are known for great quality, just like our customer service. We publish games with the largest companies on the market, like Academy Games, Asyncron Games, Cranio Creations, Crowd Games, Ediciones MasQueOca, Feuerland Spiele, Galapagos Jogos, KOSMOS, Mayfair Games, and Stonemaier Games.

This is our seventh Kickstarter campaign: in 2016 we successfully fulfilled the Germania Magna campaign, and Mark Simonitch’s Hannibal & Hamilcar in 2018. U-BOOT was fulfilled in early 2019, Nanty Narking is being prepared for delivery. Freedom! and Europe Divided are currently in production.
 
We do not expect delays in production, but unforeseen issues may arise during manufacturing and shipping. We estimate that in the worst case scenario, the production might suffer delays of at most 30-60 days, and shipping & customs may add an extra 15-45 days. We are experienced with large production runs, and we are preparing back-up plans for each step of the project, from production to shipping and final delivery.

By backing this project you agree that our primary responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into the pledge management system. You are responsible for import or other duties that may be payable to relevant tax authorities. You also accept that you are fully liable for incorrect shipping details and will risk your pledge being undeliverable or lost in transit. We are unable to ship to PO Boxes. We allow a maximum of one delivery location per backer, regardless of the number of pledges /copies ordered.

Please note that geopolitical events not under our control, such as Brexit and the imposition of new tariffs on the access of goods to a country, may change the terms we offer to residents of such countries, even if we guarantee we will do our best to avoid such issues.

updates.update_userinfo: The only photos worth seeing today
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone!

I hope you’re all well.
We’ve finally received the production report on Successors and we want to share it with you. The printing of the paper components is well on schedule and the assembly of the first copies should start as early as next week, which means that the date we’ve set for the beginning of the shipping process – early July – seems to be pretty much secure.

“There is nothing impossible to him who will try”
Alexander the Great

Hello Everyone!

We hope all is well with you and we are very happy that you have been closely following our container’s journey. So time for a status update 😊

Hello Everyone!

I hope you are all well and still looking forward to Successors.
The news that the ship with the components is coming to us will probably not surprise you. We do not want to keep you in suspense any longer, so we suggest that you follow the ship yourself... How can you do this? Below you will find a link where you can follow the ship's route in real time.

Hello Everyone!

We are very sorry for the moment of silence. All this time we were waiting for a reply from the Chinese custodian of our components and we agreed on all the details with him.
It turned out that the queue on the railways and the delays due to the lack of transports, containers and the Chinese New Year celebrations had postponed the shipment of our components a little. So we decided to cancel the railway shipment in order not to have to wait for a place and we managed to book a place on sea transport. As a result, our components will finally set sail at the end of March.

Hello Everyone!

All the components are produced and sorted, the transport process has started, but there is currently significant congestion in the logistics market, which will get worse any day now because of the Chinese New Year.
Some of our components were manufactured in China because of the technology and equipment they have. This allowed us to achieve the highest visual and manufacturing quality. The components just need to reach us now for packing to begin. With that said, there has been huge congestion on the rail lines, the containers they are transported in are in short supply and many companies are trying to get the available ones. They all have to pick up their goods, so queues form where products change hands. This is exactly what has now happened to us. We have been moved up in the queue and have to wait for more transports, but the waiting time will be extended by the Chinese New Year, which will temporarily halt the loading work.

Hello Everyone!

I hope that the new year will be more peaceful for all of us!
In the previous update, we presented you with an Example of Play, a fragment of the Playbook. I think it is high time for all of you to take a look at the Playbook in all its glory. Please write in the comment section what you think about it.
