campaign.story:
UPDATE: £28k stretch goal announced! (See below)
Bag of Dungeon: a mini-roleplaying adventure in a bag!
Bag of Dungeon, the game...
... is a dungeon crawler tile-based game harking back to the good old deadly days of adventuring, exploring dungeons, slaying monsters and stealing treasure. It's a simple-to-play tabletop game where a party of 1-4 players explores the ever-changing catacombs in a quest to find the Ring of Creation before escaping with their lives and their loot.
But can you trust your fellow adventurers? As you embark on your adventure and set foot in the dungeon, you are all loyal to the quest and each other. But once the Ring is discovered it will cast a shadow of doubt and deceit over those who seek to steal it. You may decide that being a lone wolf is a far smarter choice than loyalty, even if it means the death of your former companions.  
You will encounter monsters, find treasure and use items to stay alive and hopefully escape with the Ring before the dungeon seals itself shut, imprisoning for all eternity anyone who remains.
The game has a simple but clever mechanic; great for young and/or new gamers to learn fast and take  part while still giving more experienced gamers a satisfying time at the table. The game takes 20-60 minutes and changes every time you play. 
“Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.”
Playtesting BOD at our games club was received with great enthusiasm, even before the beer started flowing!
Hit points... 
Play alone or with up to four players
Work as a team or turn on your fellow adventurers
Delve deeper and deeper into the dungeon to find the Ring
Defeat monsters and receive loot
Collect spells, potions, weapons and armour
Use bows and spells to fight from afar or get up close with your trusty weapon to defeat the dwellers that lurk below
Simple set up and easy to play
Lightning fast combat, simple but rewarding
Broad appeal across different ages and experience
Small, lightweight and great for holidays, travel or gaming clubs
Created with a simple black, white and red design so as to fuel your own imagination and encourage roleplaying
Everything an adventurer needs... in a bag
Gameplay
The object of the game is to get in, get the Ring of Creation, and get out.
Players take turns to move their character deeper into the dungeon, fighting monsters and gaining weapons, armour, potions and spells that will aid them in discovering the Ring and escaping the dungeon. As soon as any character reaches the exit with the Ring, the dungeon seals itself shut forever, along with any adventurers still inside. 
Every game is different, every turn a challenge!
Work as a cooperative party but watch your back!
Many players prefer the loyal approach, working together and helping each other towards shared success. But once the Ring is revealed it can play on the weak-minded. Will you stick together, fight back to back and drink to a successful alliance in the tavern that night, or will you attempt to escape alone, slaying any who stand in your way?
Allegiances can be made and broken, lies and mistrust become the new enemies, and no-one will truly know who is for or against them until they emerge alive into the sunlight once more.  
One ring to woo them all, but be careful: it may sow discord and death among the players
Heroes, monsters and loot
The characters are based on the classic adventure types : dwarf, elf, human and healer. All character cards have a male/female version. We will produce more add-ons and characters in the future.  
Fill your backpacks with items and weapons
The dungeon is packed with monsters, each hell-bent on slaying the characters who dare enter their domain. Monsters are drawn randomly from the Monster Bag and remain in the dungeon until killed. From goblins to trolls, zombies to snakes, mad monks to the legendary red dragon... you'd better hope that you've found the famed Dragon Lance when you meet her!
Players also receive items from the Loot Bag, providing weapons, armour, spells, potions and magic items to aid them in their quest.
And... action!
Players roll a dice to determine the number of Action Points (APs) for their turn. They then use their APs to explore a new dungeon space, move or use items in any combination until all their APs are used up.
Exploring the dungeon
Dungeon tiles are drawn from the pile. They are laid so that an open edge joins another, creating a logical path through the dungeon. Every game is different. Finding your way in is easy; getting out is a different matter - avoiding or slaying more monsters, finding the safest and quickest route, and oftentimes doing battle with your former comrades to survive and escape.
Build your dungeon as you play, find the ring and escape!
Combat
Combat is quick and dirty with a simple but rewarding mechanic, pitting a character's armour and items against its opponent's. Fighting is played out simultaneously, reducing health with each roll until one or other of the combatants is dead or the character escapes. Defeat a monster and the character gets an item from the Loot Bag. Lose and your character drops all its items and is sent back to the entrance, losing one of its three lives. Lose all three lives and your game is over. You have failed in your quest.
Range weapons allow you to fight from afar. But beware, monsters will give chase and hunt you down. 
Make those ranged weapons count or these monsters will be upon you!
Combat is quick and deadly!
Solo game
Bag of Dungeon can be played solo. You can control up to four characters but you only get one life each. Try an easier version with all four characters or test your luck and skill by taking a lone adventurer into the darkness of the dungeon. 
Playtesting the game
The game prototype has been reprinted and tested many times with young and older experienced players and has been received with great enthusiasm:
"It started as a simple adventure with a friendly group of dungeoneers, until one player decided to take the Ring for himself and leave the rest of us to die. Then things got really interesting, and the whole game went up a gear." Russ, Playtester 
We have ironed out all the dead ends, slow downs and game breakers and streamlined the game play to give a slick hour of hacking, slaying, chasing, lying and dying.
Game design
Bag of Dungeon is designed to be the kind of retro gaming experience that takes a nostalgic trip down memory alley, but we also wanted to introduce the popular contemporary mechanics of traitors and back-stabbing. The distinctive black, white and red visual style is a modern take on simple cards and cardboard counters that typified game production of the 1980s. As we launch new expansions, cards and counters, the Bag of Dungeon family will have a distinctive and instantly recognisable identity. 
Your backpack space is limited so choose your items carefully!
Game contents
Bag of Dungeon comes in a printed cotton bag, and contains:
1 Monster Bag and 1 Loot Bag
40 floor tiles
30 monster tiles
40 item tiles
8 double-sided character cards with backpacks (male and female)
2 limited edition Kickstarter only, double-sided character cards (minotaur and hobbit)
16 coloured cubes
4 coloured meeples
2 six sided dice 
1 metal Ring of Creation
1 large cotton bag
All comes in a fancy and original printed box for storage and stacking
Keep BOD in the box for easy storage or just take the bag with you on your travels
Bag of Dungeon: everything you need to go adventuring... in a bag!
Official BOD dice tower reward!!!
If you like the clickety-clack of dice during your game, the BOD dice tower is a must reward. You will not only receive the full boxed BOD game but also an exclusive branded wooden dice tower bearing the Bag of Dungeon logo. The dice tower comes flat packed but is easily slotted together (no glue needed) to make a towering must-have for your new game.
Behold! The BOD wooden dice tower, an exclusive Kickstarter reward
Branded with the BOD dragon logo, the tower is easy to build, needs no glue and folds flat for easy travel
Stretch goal!
This is what you're going to receive in every game box if we achieve a campaign total of £28,000.
The Dragon Scrolls: get 'em while they're hot!
11 (not 10), new challenges and quests to add to your BoD world!
Join us on our adventure
If you'd like to help us make Bag of Dungeon a must have item for gaming shelves around the world, please pledge your support, join the party and grab yourself some lovely loot.
If you have any questions please get in touch.
Note: The game shown is a prototype. Some illustrations, stats or floor tiles may change slightly. We have everything in place to start printing, production schedule poised for action, parts sourced and everything costed down to the last copper piece. 
We are equipped and ready to go forth and conquer!
When will I get my loot?
We plan to deliver all pledge rewards anywhere in the world within two months of hitting our funding goal. We'll keep you posted regularly on progress and production milestones.
You'll also be able to contact us direct during production if you have any questions.
About the designer... 
Tim Sharville is a freelance game designer and illustrator. He has been working in print design and branding for many years and attended the London College of Printing for art and design. He runs a small independent design company called Gunpowder Studios (but basically he's an inventor who plays too many board games;)
Thanks to everyone from the gaming and kickstarter community for your support so far. What a loyal bunch you are!
Finally thanks to my very special gaming friends for all your help and support on BOD, Andy, Russ (the mechanic), Julian, Mick (the monk) for working out the numbers, and especially brother Paul for proof reading and editing the game over and over again and letting me play his copy of Tunnels and Trolls back in 1983.
Note: Bag of Dungeon is in prototype form only (we have had a small number printed for testing) and it's not for sale anywhere in the world yet. If we get funded it will literally Kickstart us for the first time ever into production, which is very exciting!
About the printer
Ludo Fact are a well established game printing company based in Germany. They have many years experience in the board and card game arena and have some of the best selling titles onboard such as: AZUL, CODENAMES, CARCASSONNE, 7 WONDERS and many more...
See here for other great titles Ludo Fact have worked on: https://www.ludofact.de/en-gb/products/references/
We are excited to have them onboard and love the fact Bag of Dungeon will soon become another in their excellent portfolio!
See you all in the tavern!
© Gunpowder Studios - All rights reserved
Game design and concept by Tim Sharville
Gaming in other languages!
If we are funded we will release online rules in German, Italian, French and Spanish. These will be available to download FREE as PDFs via our website.
Delivery times
The delivery times shown are an estimate only based on schedules allocated by our printer. We cannot guarantee an exact date for the delivery of your games but will honour this as closely as possible.
After the campaign has run we will post regular updates.
Any questions post Kickstarter please contact us via our website: www.gunpowderstudios.co.uk
Twitter: @gunpowder

updates.update_content:
Thanks to the incredible dedication of our very own key workers, Fred the postal gnome and his sister, Freda, Bag of Dungeon is now residing on shelves and tables far and wide. There was a slight delay while we made sure that Fred and Freda were working under the safest possible conditions. We take very seriously our responsibilities to our staff and have implemented further measures to protect them. This includes Fred's own request for PPE - a Pint and a Pickled Egg - and Freda's - Pretty Pink Earrings - both of which seem to be doing the trick. 
Fred and Freda have also been tested for coronavirus. The results were interesting. Fred's results initially came back positive, but a time-lapse recording from the electron microscope showed the virus entering his system, taking one look at its new home and deciding to leave immediately. More bizarre was Freda's test which showed the virus actively being chased from her system by a group of angry T cells armed with what looked like tiny cast-iron frying pans. We have since been contacted by the coronavirus asking to be tested for Fred and Freda.

updates.update_userinfo: Bag of Dungeon Rules Update V1.1 (now with even angrier monsters)

updates.update_content:
Alas, we have now come to the end of the first chapter in the Bag of Dungeon chronicles. Amazing! What fun we have had to make this especially for you, watching all the comments coming in and responding to your feedback. The community has been a key player in our journey, so once again, a big thanks to all of you for your patience and genuinely helpful feedback. It has even kept Fred on his toes (which still only takes him to just above three feet tall). 
Speaking of Fred, he's on a short break now; we've sent him on a gnome improvement course with a view to expanding his junior management responsibilities. We have great faith in our erstwhile postal assistant who, despite his many anti-social difficulties, means well and is very devoted to the project (although we don't think offering to fight anyone who makes a negative comment is necessarily the best way to deal with criticism, hence the course). To give him his due, he's utterly fearless and despite his small stature there is literally only one creature in the world he's scared of and that's his twin, Freda, but then we're all a bit scared of her.

Fred has had enough and headed off in a huff to the Wasted Wizard. It's 2 for 1 on Double Damage and it's also Freda's birthday. We might have been able to persuade him to stay if it had only been Freda's birthday, but...
Despite Fred's early departure, we are 99% there on our mailings as of this evening. In fact, as I'm typing this, there are four very decent chaps who have given up their Friday evening to help us pack games, affix labels and stuff postal sacks.

updates.update_userinfo: Bag of Dungeon now shipping direct to your kitchen table
updates.update_content:
Hello, it's Fred the Gnome here...
Is this microphone on?
That's my drink... yeah, well, get your own. I'm trying to pack boxes here...
So, the boss left his Kickstarter login and password next to his bacon and egg sandwich this morning and I thought I'd send a quick update on the terrible conditions under which I am forced to work. First off, the workplace is far from ideal for someone of my stature (although I am considered above average height for a gnome, just so you know). The packing table in the back room of the Wasted Wizard sits well above my head height. Two days ago, I asked for a box to stand on, and I'm still waiting (which is ironic, considering that I'm surrounded by 1,500 little boxes). Second, my contract said I'd get a flagon of Double Damage (12.5%) on the hour every hour while I was packing, but the landlord just leaves that on the table too, so I can't reach that either.

updates.update_userinfo: There's something lurking in a south London warehouse... Bag of Dungeon has arrived!
updates.update_content:
Great news backers! The Kickstarter editions of Bag of Dungeon have arrived in London, and are ready for despatch.
We've opened a couple up and they look fantastic. Thanks again to Ludo Fact, who have done us proud on the quality. 
Now comes the Herculean task of distribution to all our lovely customers. Fortunately, Fred the Gnome has been on a label-licking course and is now set up in a corner of the Wasted Wizard ready to begin affixing your address details to each game (apologies if the box smells slightly of alcohol when you receive it).

updates.update_userinfo: One ring to woo them all...
updates.update_content:
Hi backers,
Time for a mini update...
We have just received news from Germany that the ring tokens have been cast in the fires of Mount Ludo Fact - see the image below. We hope you like them. Every game will have one of these beauties. Warning: This may look like a wooden disc with a flame on it but it has the power to corrupt even the strongest of minds.

updates.update_userinfo: Rules updates, new logo and the dreaded Brexit deadline!
updates.update_content:
Hi backers and friends of BoD.
Time for a short update on where we are. Ok, so you may remember we had a little setback with the bags and the metal ring (EU regulations and all that!). This has now been resolved and the bags and new ring counter are looking great. We've had some pre-production samples back, which we're very pleased with (see image).

Hi all. It's been a while since we sent an update, so we thought we'd share with you where we are on our journey. We have been very busy with final proofing, testing, tweaking and clearing the rock falls from those dead ends.
The good news is...
Bag of Dungeon is  heading off to the printers in sunny Germany next week for an audience with the printing god known as Heidelberger Speedmaster XL-145. This is all bang on schedule.

updates.update_userinfo: We made it to the exit!
updates.update_content:
Yes, folks, WE did it!
Almost 1,000 of you put your hard-earned gold into bringing Bag of Dungeon to life, which is amazing! Well done and thank you again.
There was much merriment in the Wasted Wizard last night as we watched the late pledges come in, and we were still there when the campaign ended this morning, admittedly a little the worse for wear. The only person not celebrating was our favourite beleaguered postal gnome, who now has sole responsibility for delivering all the BoD goodies to each and every one of you, but he's only grumpy when he's sober and we've promised him a new enchanted postal sack, which cheered him up a bit.

They will have to bear with the immoderate hunger of this sacred animal for the juicy and tender bamboo. The player who manages his land plots best, growing the most bamboo while feeding the delicate appetite of the panda, will win the game.

campaign.story:
YOU DID IT! We unlocked the Alternate Finale Pack #1 for all Career backers!
Hostage Negotiator: Career is the grand finale to the Hostage Negotiator product line... taking the experience to heights you won't believe!
You've graduated the academy. And now it is time to prove yourself. Can you hold up to the stresses of multiple hostage negotiations? Not to mention the stresses of your career and personal life? Only one way to find out...
The all-in Commissioner (Plus Mat) pledge show here. Click to see in full glory.
Hostage Negotiator: Career requires most of the existing Hostage Negotiator content, and frankly, it is best if you own it all.  But don't worry, if you are missing something you'll be able to fill in the gaps by adding those products to your pledge. 
And if you are new? You have the option of backing for the Lieutenant level which is the minimum required to be able to play HN: Career or what we highly recommend, which is to back at the Commissioner Level for everything in the entire line at an incredible price.
Contents and/or counts are subject to change before final production
 This summary will explain how HN: Career works. It assumes you already know how to play Hostage Negotiator. If you don't, that's ok and we have included some helpful videos down below that will show you everything you need to know!
HN Career is a system that turns your Hostage Negotiator experience into a connected, epic, 10 year campaign. You will experience more than just the tense moments of your negotiations. You'll also experience the key events in the days between them. A campaign will generally take a total of 4-6 hours of game time and the system is completely replayable and the events of the campaign and which Abductors you face will be different each time!
Each campaign round is ONE YEAR of your Career. Many things can happen in a year as you will soon find out. Here we have a look at the Career sheet. 
 As you can see, you will be tracking several stats. You can mark these with pieces while you play, and then circle where you are at the end of your session to save your game. You'll also be recording the results of your negotiations and some key stats from each of them.
Each year in your Career consists of 4 phases: 
1. The Stressor Event phase
Throughout the course of your career, some events will cause you to add a Stressor Card to the Stressor Deck. In this phase, you will draw one Stressor Card at random from the Stressor Deck and resolve it. If there are no cards in the deck, you just move on to the next phase. These cards have a similar format to the Career and Personal event cards which you'll see examples of below.
2. The Career Event phase
In the Career Event phase, you will resolve a Career Card for the year you are in. Most years have 5 different Career Cards, so every Career you play will have many different events! These events will relate more to your career.
 You will be presented with a narrative event and then be given a choice. Choose wisely as your choice will have meaningful impacts on your career!
When you have made your choice, take the Red Decoder and place it over the text on that side of the card to find out the results of your choice. Then you will apply them as indicated.
 For example, in this case, you would increase Personal Stress by 1 and add a random "Cigarettes" Stressor card to the Stressor Deck.
Lastly, you will flip the Career card over and read the Crisis! segment of the card. Usually, this will result in you getting called to the scene of a negotiation and playing a round of Hostage Negotiator against one of the Abductors. You'll usually draw from the Campaign Abductor deck to see which Abductor you will be facing.
3. The Negotiation phase
The Negotiation phase is where you will play a game of Hostage Negotiator against the Abductor randomly chosen from the Campaign Abductor Deck. Make sure you apply any effects from other cards that may effect how the negotiation is set-up. Then you'll play out your negotiation.
When the negotiation ends, record your results on the Career Sheet. What happens in your negotiations could effect things later on!
4. The Personal Event phase
In the Personal Event phase, you will resolve a Personal Card. These are not specific to year like the Career cards. There are 25 different Personal Cards, so you will have a variety of different events each campaign. These events will relate more to your personal life.
Again you will be given a narrative event and a choice and will apply the results of your choice. 
Finally, apply the Negotiation Impacts at the bottom of the Personal card. These impacts will vary based on your success or failure in the negotiation. 
And that would conclude 1 Full Year of Hostage Negotiator Career! You could stop and save, or immediately move on to the next year! I wonder what will happen with that Stressor...
What else can happen? Tell me more!
The answer to that is A LOT! Here are a few more things you can expect to see in the game. 
Stress Checks
During the game you may be asked to make a "Career Stress Check" or a "Personal Stress Check".  When this happens you will roll a die and compare it to the stress level. If the roll is higher than your stress level you pass the check, if not, it is failed.   
 Merit Checks, Rolling for Promotion, and Rank
As your career progresses you may get a chance to be promoted! When this happens you will make a Merit Check. To pass the check and get promoted you need to roll lower than your merit level.   When you get promoted, your Rank will increase. 
At the beginning of the game you will start as an Officer. As your career progresses, you could achieve a rank as high as Captain. Each time your rank increases you will get... oh wait, can't tell you that. But obviously, getting promoted is GOOD and you will be happy!
Rewards
You will earn rewards as you play. These are different things that will give you benefits. Maybe a promotion, some vacation time, or maybe an Advanced Skill! Advanced Skills will direct you to open a special box or envelope that comes with your game. What could be inside???? 
Traits
As you progress, your personality will be formed through your decisions and your skill as a negotiator. You will gain traits based on your decisions. Some may be good, some not so good. What kind of negotiator and person will you be? 
How does it end?
The campaign will usually end after your 10th year although it can end before that with a shameful retirement if you lose too many hostages. If you make it through year 10, you will then play a special end game finale. A climax to your career that can end in a variety of different ways. All of them dramatic. 
We are very excited to offer the final 2 Abductor Packs. One of the new packs is from a veteran game designer, T.C. Petty III and developed by Mikolaj Laczynski. The other is from a new designer and our very own, Shaun Varsos and developed by A.J. Porfirio. These packs, like the others, add a new scenario with new mechanisms and challenges.  All packs are compatible with Hostage Negotiator, Crime Wave, and Career.
 *Please note while we have previously outsourced production of the custom meeples with Meeple Source, for this campaign all of our custom meeples will be produced from our own manufacturer.
RETAILER PLEDGE
We welcome pledges from Retailers. Due to the extensiveness of this product line and quantity of different products offered, we ask that you contact us directly through the Kickstarter Messaging system to inquire about retailer pricing.
VERY IMPORTANT! You MUST own or purchase: Hostage Negotiator (base game), Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave, and at least 7 Abductor Packs (but the more the better).
Pictured is the minimum needed to play Hostage Negotiator: Career.
These products are completely optional, but can add to the experience: Demand Pack #1, All Negotiator Cards, and the custom meeples. If you are starting now and back at the Commissioner Level, don't worry! Your package will come with all of these! 
Other Optional products available as add-on only: 2019 Dice Tower Negotiator Cards and 2019 Secret Cabal - Year 0 Career Card. These are special promos that are add ons only regardless of what level you pledge for.
Only need certain items? Check out the add-ons section below!
Because Hostage Negotiator Career is so unique and requires BOTH previous base games, but also expansion packs, it is fairly likely that many of you will need add-ons. To pledge for add-ons, you just need to add additional $ equal to the amount for the items you want and need. You can do this now, on KS (it helps reach Stretch Goals!) or in our post campaign pledge manager, you will be able to make your selections and finalize your add-on choices. 
Here are all of the Add-Ons and their cost:
For example, Mary has everything except for Abductor Packs 2 & 3 and the new stuff (Career and APs 9&10). She backs at the $40 level for the new stuff, but she needs to add $5 for pack #2 and $5 for pack #3. She also wants the custom game mat which is $20. So she clicks "manage your pledge" and adds $30 to bring her total pledge to $70 before shipping is applied. 
Stretch goals achieved and yet to come are shown below!
We ship from within the USA, Canada, Asia, Australia, and the European Union. Shipping will be charged after the campaign and will be based on weight and destination. Here are some range estimates for some popular locations. We strive to keep shipping costs as low as possible.
Watch it Played presents - How to Play Hostage Negotiator
Rahdo Runs Through Hostage Negotiator
Maybe you are wondering "Why no videos on the Career Expansion?" 
Here is why:
1) We feel very strongly about keeping the game content and surprises of HN: Career a secret to be discovered by each player upon release. Only a select handful of internal parties and trusted playtesters have experienced the Career Expansion as a prototype. Although it is not "legacy" per se and can be replayed over and over, it has some "legacy-like" elements to it that we don't want spoiled! :)
2) Secondly, the Career expansion provides content that "surrounds" and "enhances" the experience of Hostage Negotiator. So if you don't think you will like Hostage Negotiator based on the videos above, then the Career expansion probably isn't going to change that.
However, because we want you to have a little bit of a taste of what is to come, as part of this Kickstarter we will host a "mini 3 year campaign" and if you own HN and/or Crime Wave (both are available now from your local game store or online from our website at vanrydergames.com!), YOU can play along at home!
Free to play throughout this Kickstarter!
We are supporting a mini-Career campaign during this Kickstarter that will allow YOU to play along with a short 3-year career that will take place throughout the KS campaign! You will be able to experience what the Career expansion will be like by playing along! This is completely free to play (however you must own HN and/or CrimeWave at minimum) and you are under no obligation to back the Career project or do anything else to play along. Having said that, we greatly appreciate any social media shares and any other discussing of the campaign you might feel inclined to do!
So, let’s jump in shall we? Oh, one thing to note real quick. This mini-campaign is completely made up and none of the cards or story events in this mini-campaign are actually in the Career Expansion. The campaign sheet, Officer rank card, rules, and overall structure are, however, exactly the same as what you will find in Career. 
 First things first, go ahead and print this Career Sheet.  
 Set your starting stress levels on the shaded areas, you can circle with a pencil or use a game piece of your choice to track your stats. Go ahead and write your name on your business card as well, so we can get your badge and credentials processed, Officer! Speaking of Officer, here is your Rank Card.  
 Now let’s begin! It is Year 1… 
The first Phase of each year is The Stressor Event phase. In Year 1, you won’t have any Stressors yet so we can skip right on through this for now.
Phase 2 is The Career Event phase. So we have to draw a Career Event card and resolve it. It will be one of several for each given year of the campaign, that you will draw one from at random.  
In some years, you will add new Campaign Abductor cards to the Campaign Abductor deck before resolving the event. In Year 1, you will add the following Abductors to the deck: Arkayne (HN base), Donna (HN base), Edward (HN base), Lijah (HNCW), Seaver (AP6). If you don't own all of these abductors right now, don't worry. Just use what you have.
 Let's take a look at the event...  
Don't worry about finding a red viewfinder, just make your choice and we will reveal the resolutions below!
It really is quite simple… read the text of the event. You have 2 choices. Go ahead and make your choice now… you might want to consider how your choice could impact your stress levels and your life in general. 
Got it? Ok well let’s take a look at the results… to do so, we’ll hold our red viewfinder over the choice we made and resolve it. 
If you decided to "Check the Bulletin Board for Anything of Interest" read the resolution below. Otherwise, scroll past the first one for the resolution to "Head Outside for A Smoke". 
+1 CS means you need to increase your Career Stress. Note that higher stress is NOT a good thing. 
 +1 PS means you need to increase your Personal Stress. Note that higher stress is NOT a good thing. Additionally, you have gained a Stressor. When this happens, we find the Stressor Cards labeled "Cigarettes", shuffle them and put one at random in the Active Stressor Deck. This is the first Stressor you've gotten, so it is the first card in that deck.  
This is not a real Stressor in the game
Whatever you chose, go ahead and adjust the stat on your Career Sheet! If a Stressor was gained, that card was added to the Stressor Deck. One Stressor from the deck will be resolved in the first phase of each Year!
Finally, let’s take a look at the CRISIS! Section of the Career Event card by flipping it upside down… 
The Crisis section is resolved last in Phase 2
It looks like you have a job to do! When your Career starts, only certain Abductors can show up when you draw one at random from the Campaign Abductor Deck.  Now you would draw one to see who you will be playing against in phase 3, the Negotiation Phase. Since this mini-campaign is presented remotely go ahead and select a random abductor from those in the deck (Arkayne, Donna, Edward, Lijah, or Seavers) by a random method of your choice. 
It is now Phase 3 - The Negotiation Phase. Set up and play a game of Hostage Negotiator against the abductor you chose at random. When you are finished, mark the results on your Career Sheet! 
This campaign has continued in the first update of this Kickstarter! Follow the link below to resolve Phase 4 - The Personal Event Phase! Please make sure you allow notifications from this project so you won't miss any updates!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Van Ryder Games has successfully funded and fulfilled many projects. We learn more and more with each experience. Our goal is to get the game to you, our supporters, as quickly as possible, but we won't sacrifice quality for speed.

There are the usual risks of printing, shipping, customs, and other unintended delays, but you can be sure we will deliver the game to you as promised. Feel free to ask any of our returning backers!
A few remarks we want to share with you regarding our approach for our projects, including this one.
1. Communication is of the utmost importance to us. Please ask any and all questions and we will answer as quickly as possible. 
2. Our stretch goal items are determined by us before the campaign begins, in the event all of them are achieved we will not add more as it puts our project timeline and cost at risk. 
3. Your comments and feedback are REALLY important to us. If you have an idea, concern, or compliment, please share it with us! We can't promise to implement or act on every idea that comes our way, but we will certainly consider each one! 
4. We pledge to keep a positive attitude regardless of the success or failure of this project and we ask that you do the same. 
5. To have fun! Kickstarter projects can be stressful, but these are games and the most important thing is to have FUN!

Please note the following is our policy on pledges and refunds.

Refund Policy 

All pledges are final upon the completion of the funding period, however we may, at our sole discretion, refund your pledge in full if the request is made within two weeks of the end of the campaign. Any request for refund after more than two weeks has passed, if accepted by us, will be subject to a 10-20% cancellation fee to account for KS fees and administrative expenses. Please note that, anyone that does not complete the pledge manager by our required deadlines will not be eligible for a refund for any reason, including the assessment of additional shipping fees for expenses related to the delinquency of the survey information.

Abandoned Pledges 

We require that our pledge manager and/or survey be completed in a timely manner so that we can process orders efficiently and on time. Completing your survey late at any point beyond the deadline we communicate, could result in significant delays in receiving your rewards, additional shipping expense, duties, taxes, or other fees to be paid by you, and you will not be eligible for a refund for any reason. Final Girl is finally here
We've shown you previews and teases for over a year, but it's finally arrived. Final Girl, an evolution of the Hostage Negotiator system, is a survival horror game for solo players. You'll take on the role of several young women and face off against one of the dreadful killers.

First and foremost, I hope all of you are safe
This is an unprecedented time in the history of our world. I hope everyone is staying safe and healthy. We at VRG are fortunate enough to be able to do most of our work from home and we continue to plug away on our projects.
A wild story aka the update on shipping

If you ever tasted a date, you know how delicious they are
We just got some from the store, they are these little... ah wait, we aren't talking about THOSE kinds of dates! We are talking about some dates for HN Career product to leave the factory!

Surveys will be reopened tomorrow, Feb 18th, for payment of Shipping
Hello backers, the time has come to charge the shipping amount for your Hostage Negotiator: Career rewards. Tomorrow morning Feb. 18th (probably around 10 AM CST) all of the CrowdOx surveys are scheduled to be reopened so you can pay for shipping. As indicated during the campaign, the shipping amount is weight-based and depends on the destination of your address. Two Wave shipping add-on was a separate charge to get some items early, so even if you added the Two Wave shipping option, you need to pay for final shipping to make sure you get the rest of your rewards.

updates.update_userinfo: Production Update and first Mass Production Copy photos!
updates.update_content:
Production and impacts to the schedule
Hey backers! Last time we checked in with you we provided an update with a date estimate of around Feb 20th for the games to be ready to leave the factory. This was based on the expectation that the factory would be up and running on Feb. 3rd after Chinese New Year was over. Unfortunately, as you have probably heard by now, the Corona Virus situation is having major effects in China and, as a result, the factory has not yet reopened. Our manufacturer has informed us that they are tentatively planning to reopen on Feb 17th, but the situation with the Corona Virus could have additional impacts on that date. We are hopeful that they can reopen soon, but at this point the Feb 20 for the goods to leave the factory date previously reported is not going to happen. That, of course, pushes back final delivery as well. We've had delays in the past, but we can honestly say this is the first time that a health epidemic has been the cause. We ask for your patience for just a little bit longer as the picture becomes a bit clearer. Once it does, we will come back to you with some expectations on the dates.

campaign.story:
Monster Slaughter: Underground is an expansion for Monster Slaughter.
This time, you'll be going in to the deepest horror – the cabin's basement!
Terror sometimes makes you crazy… After splitting up into small groups, stumbling blindly through poorly lit rooms, now the guests think they're safe in the basement! Will it be their salvation? Or… their tomb?
This expansion adds more components to your base game: more bonus action cards, object cards, nocturnal event cards, and a new set of basement event cards. And that's not all!  It also gives you a new 3D room, new scenarios, new surprise visitors, and a new mutation system! 
Please note that Monster Slaughter: Underground is not a stand-alone, and requires a copy of Monster Slaughter. However, a Kickstarter version of the original game is not required. The expansion is fully compatible with the retail version of the original game!
Let's open the basement door!
All stretch goals have been unlocked, thank you!
Click here to reach Monster Slaughter: Underground's BGG page!

Our German distribution partner will be Board Game Box
The upgrade kit contains all these exclusive minis from the first campaign!
Want to know more?  ▼  ▼  ▼
campaign.risks:

Monster Slaughter and Krosmaster Blast's Kickstarter campaigns taught us a lot and we managed to reach – even exceed – the goals we'd set for ourselves and overcome the challenges that came up along the way. Our commitment to players is absolute: You made our dreams come true and pushed us to go further. We'll do everything we can to make this campaign an absolute slaughter with you and produce a knock-out board game with monstrous content!

If you want to slaughter us with questions, check out our FAQ where you'll find a barrage of answers! You can also leave comments below. We love your feedback!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Click to Read the Preview
If you are not familiar with Terraforming Mars, we suggest that you watch one of these great videos to see why Terraforming Mars is an international best seller, and the #4 ranked board game of all time on BoardGameGeek.com! 
We are very excited to be able to offer our Kickstarter backers with a number of great extra items for their support. We will be announcing a new milestone reward every day during this project and every copy of Terraforming Mars: Turmoil sent out to backers of this project will include all these milestone rewards. 
Note that anything marked with these symbols are: 
Promo - An item that Kickstarter backers will get in their rewards, and will not be included in the retail edition of Terraforming Mars: Turmoil. These items may be released at a future date as promotional materials and/or game expansions.
Promo items from this project will be available in the future from all the partners participating in this project, and from all the partners not participating. There is nothing in this project that is exclusive to pledging for this project. Each partner that makes Terraforming Mars will determine how they will distribute promos in their languages after the project ends.  
Terraforming Mars: Turmoil is the biggest and most strategic expansion for the best selling tile placement and card drafting game, Terraforming Mars.  The base game of Terraforming Mars is required to use this expansion. For more information about Terraforming Mars: Turmoil, we encourage you to read our draft rulebook here.
If you are not familiar with Terraforming Mars, we suggest that you watch this great video to learn the rules. You can also read the complete game rules here.
Please note that Terraforming Mars: Turmoil should be considered an EXPERT expansion. This expansion adds a distinct, new level of play as players vie for control of the Terraforming Council, as well as plan for the Global Events.  This expansion will appeal to those who want to play a more expansive game of Terraforming Mars.
Terraforming Mars: Turmoil is the 49th project from the combined teams behind Stronghold Games, Indie Boards and Cards, & Action Phase Games. With the successful execution of our first 48 projects, we have become experienced publishers with a reputation for great games (in design and production) that are delivered in a timely fashion. 
Terraforming Mars: Turmoil was designed by the talented Jacob Fryxelius, and developed by the Fryxelius brothers of FryxGames. This game has undergone extensive testing and development to ensure the best possible experience. We are confident that this game will be in your collection for years to come. 
Terraforming Mars: Turmoil is the fifth expansion that takes players back to Mars for the struggle to control and progress human society. 
Kickstarter is the world's largest funding platform for creative projects. Every month, tens of thousands of people pledge millions of dollars to creative projects in dozens of categories. 
A person who supports a project is called a "backer." The process of giving money to this project is called a "pledge." 
In return for your pledge, we (the creators of the campaign) are able to offer "rewards," depending on the amount you pledge. For example, if you pledge $34 to help back the project, we'll offer you a copy of the game along with any stretch goals we achieve as soon as it is manufactured. 
You can become a backer in just four easy steps: 
 Step 1: Read through the pledge levels and rewards we're offering in the right sidebar of this page. 
 Step 2: Click the large, green "BACK THIS PROJECT" button to the right of the trailer video at the top of this page. 
 Step 3: Enter your pledge amount, and complete the steps for filling in your information. This process takes just a few seconds! That's it! It's really that simple! Thank you for backing!
 Step 4: Shortly after the projects ends on May 5th, we will send you a link to our pledge manager. This is where we will get your shipping information and which language versions of the game you would like to receive.
Once you've backed this project, we encourage you to share this page on social media platforms, such as Facebook and Twitter, and share with your friends and family. Also, be sure to like Stronghold Games on Facebook and follow us on Twitter for real-time updates about this project and more!  
Stronghold Games is excited to offer retailer packages on the English Language editions of Turmoil for Brick and Mortar stores. Many of our partners are also offering retailer packages for their language editions as well.
For more information, please email us at: retailers@indieboardsandcards.com or contact your local language partner directly.
Every backer is important to us, regardless of location, but the reality is that shipping and sales taxes are very expensive and is a cost we all need to share. To offset this, while remaining fiscally responsible, we have included a discount on ALL shipping and taxes, but there is no free shipping. Shipping & Taxes charges will be added after Kickstarter ends, every backer will be responsible for paying these fees in the pledge manager after the campaign ends. Please see shipping & taxes chart below: 
For the US, Canada, UK, EU, Brazil, Japan, Thailand and Korea we have included applicable taxes, your rewards will be sent Duty Free from within your region – there will not be any additional customs charge. Outside of the US, Canada, UK and the EU, we cannot guarantee customs friendly shipping in these areas. There may be additional duties and/or fees charged by your country's governmental agencies and/or shipping partners. Those fees are solely your responsibility, and we can neither cancel a pledge nor will we pay those fees. In case a package is returned or destroyed due to non-payment of such fees, your pledge will be considered fulfilled. 
Stronghold Games has full responsibility for rewards sent to the USA, UK, Canada, Australia and all other countries not listed below.
MINDOK has full responsibility for rewards sent to the Czech Republic and Slovakia.
Maldito has full responsibility for rewards sent to Spain, Mexico, and Latin America except Brazil.

Siam Board Games has full responsibility for rewards sent to Thailand. 
 MARS ATTACKS: (Pledge $34 or more) One copy of Terraforming Mars: Turmoil including all of the milestones from this campaign. Shipping and taxes are not included in the price - please see our shipping & taxes section below for more details. For additional copies in the US and international, check our rates below.

Shipping and taxes are not included in the price - please see our shipping & taxes section below for more details. For additional copies in the US and international, check our rates below.

Shipping and taxes are not included in the price - please see our shipping & taxes section below for more details. For additional copies in the US and international, check our rates below.
It is important that everyone knows that we are using a pledge manager. That means you’ll be able to manage your pledge amount for all the add-ons that you want after the project closes, along with during the campaign. We will post an update to notify backers when the pledge manager email is being sent out. At that time, you’ll need to manage your pledge and enter your shipping address and complete your order. You will be able to select the language for your games in the pledge manager.
Our plan is to have Terraforming Mars: Turmoil available at Essen. While our current production schedule looks like Kickstarter rewards will ship out around the time of Essen, it may be the case that we have games at Essen before the Kickstarter backer copies are sent. It may also be the case that we are unable to get games to Essen in time. I wish we were able to absolutely guarantee results, but we simply know that we can't make such commitments when so many other parties are involved in the process.  
If you want Essen pickup – DO NOT PLEDGE FOR THIS PROJECT 
Turmoil and all the milestones will be available in Essen – your support is very valuable to Stronghold Games and we look forward to seeing you again this year with lots of great new games.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the 49th Kickstarter project from the combined teams behind Stronghold Games, Indie Boards and Cards & Action Phase Games. We have learned how to streamline the game publishing process and have successfully delivered all of our previous Kickstarter projects to thousands of supporters. Our previous experiences will enable us to also deliver this project on time and we have every confidence that Terraforming Mars: Turmoil will be on schedule and of the highest possible quality.
That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Stronghold Games, Indie Boards and Cards, & Action Phase Games will use contract manufacturing to make this game, freight forwarders to get games through customs, and 3rd parties like Amazon, the US Post Office, and FEDEX to ship the games to you – we don't control everything and there are lots of opportunities for delay. We have a track record of making everything work out for backers in the end – so please be confident and supportive of our efforts to get this great game into your hands.

REFUND POLICY
We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

campaign.story:
Carnival Zombie is a cooperative board game for 1 to 6 players, following a group of characters who are fleeing on terra firma from a sinking city overrun by zombies. Players control this party of heroes as they fight their way to one of the possible escape routes out of the city. During the night they face restless hordes of zombies, while during the day they recover, move, or search for useful items and survivors.    

REPLAYABILITY: 9 characters for 465 possible parties, 3 difficulty levels, 2 campaigns with 8 overall finales, 6 scenarios and 8 finales playable as scenarios, 16 bosses = over 450 hours of gameplay! Stretch goals not counted...


 CHARACTERS GAMEPLAY
During the day, at first they move together as a group through the sinking city towards the finales locations, then each one spends the remaining hours in preparation for the night: building barricades, recovering from wounds, searching for items and survivors, or using his unique day ability. During the night, they face hordes of Infected and Boss: they have few actions to perform and their unique ability to survive behind the refuge barricades in a fast and furious firefight. Only by close cooperation they could have a chance to stand until the sunlight, when the horde retreats! If they’re attacked, they accumulate stress until becoming terrified! And if one gets too much stress.. that’s game over! Be ready to face the most stressful game ever! 
BOSS GAMEPLAY
The Boss lead the horde of Infected during the night. Each one of them has powerful unique abilities that combine creating some very nasty situation to face. If you manage to kill them, you’ll get powerful rewards, but you need to carefully cooperate with you team mates to survive!     
CARDS GAMEPLAY
Nightmare cards are used in two ways: at the center of the card is portrayed a random event that will affect your day, while at the four corners there are boxes used for randomization. Item and weapons can be collected in two ways: by actively looking for them during the day or by killing a Boss. Items and weapons can be persistent bonuses or just one shot items, some will affect the day, while others will help you during the night. All of them can be sacrificed to save you from an attack.  Boss tarots are used to discover the dreadful enemies you’ll face at night and to remind you of those you could not kill, because they will hunt you every night after.  
 SCENARIOS
The 2nd Edition includes awesome new scenarios that will allow you to face totally new challenges! Some of the features that you will find in the scenarios are tutorial scenario, shorter & harder games, traitor mechanics, scalability (variable number of characters, one character for each player), competitive game, more dexterity game and night-only scenarios! Finales also can be played as stand-alone scenarios! 
PILE OF CORPSES GAMEPLAY
In Carnival Zombie combat, you know exactly what you get when you pull the trigger: no dice is rolled. But when you shoot zombie, you cannot be totally sure that they will stay down.  
So you have to pick up the cubes you just eliminated with firepower and drop them upon the Pile of Corpses tile. Those falling will rise again, still charging at you: the more you shoot, the more difficult the drop!    
 TERRAINS: OBSTACLES AND FORTIFICATIONS GAMEPLAY
You have to choose wisely where to face the night: the presence of fortifications will help you keeping at bay the horde, but you have also to be careful of the terrain, because the infected will take advantage from it to draw near more easily: you have to adapt your strategy to the environment! 

 SURVIVORS GAMEPLAY
You can find survivors while scavenging for items. They will follow you and help you  during the night: although they’re not fighters, they can be precious allies in the times of need!
The DELUXE box will be available only during the KICKSTARTER campaign. It adds to the base box a double-sided game board and tons of new contents! 

 MEDIOLANUM gameplay
Fight your way into Mediolanum! Avoid Founderings or the Leviathan will show himself to unleash the horde upon you! Battle difficult increases as you move closer to the center, but there it’s easier to find the clues to descover the combintation needed to destroy the beast and run away from the city in 3 new unique finales with Leonardo Da Vinci’s machinery fleeing the horde, the boss or the Leviathan itself!    
 ÜBER WEAPONS GAMEPLAY
Über weapons have to be searched for during the day and recovered on the city map. Once you acquire them, they can be deployed during the night and used to unleash powerful abilities upon the incoming horde. Be sure to pull the trigger at the right time because Carnival Zombie is absolutely unforgiving.   
We have a lot of new content that we would like to make: we need your help! 
If we reach 1,000 LIKES on our FACEBOOK page, every backer will get 6 new object cards! 
ARTWORK pledge notes
You will get one of the original pencil drawings made by Jocularis for Carnival Zombie. There are just 24 of these and they’re all different. Since they are unique, the first person to pledge will choose first, then the second person to pledge will choose next, and so on. 

TOURIST pledge notes
Scientific evidence shows that the Zombie Apocalypse is a reality: it could come from rage virus, neurotoxins, spontaneous neurogenesis, nanobots or creepy fungus parasite brainwashing you. Anyway, we know for sure that the most likely origin will be the  huge undead leviathan awakening beneath Venice or Milan. So what if Zombie Apocalypse hits just when you’re in Venice or Milan? Wouldn’t you like to have the best chances of survival? And wouldn’t your chances be higher if you could face the Infected with those that foresaw such Apocalypse and portrayed it into a boardgame? If you plan to visit Venice or Milan anytime soon, be wise: insure your life by purchasing the Tourist Pledge! By pledging for Tourist, we will be with you in Venice or Milan at a specific date and you will have the best chances of survival just in case the Zombie Apocalypse hits that very day! We will guide you outside the city to safety, ensuring that no harm comes to you: by pledging for Tourist, you’re pledging for you own life at a very discounted price! 
By the way, if no Leviathan awakes freeing us from all “fight for your life” stuff, at least 2 of us will still meet up with you in Venice or Milan. 
We will meet at around 09:00 AM and will hang out with you until as late as 17:00 PM. 
We will visit some Carnival Zombie-related sites or some creepy unacknowledged locations: a Master graduate in History and a Master graduate in Art will show you things unknown to the most! 
You will be our guest for lunch in a traditional tavern;
If you like the idea, we will playtest one of our games still under development with you (otherwise we could move on to our “creepy unacknowledged location” tour);
We could also share with you our experiences here at ALBE PAVO and possibly give you some advice for your own projects, if you have any. 
You will also have an exclusive original artwork made by Jocularis. 
CARNIVAL ZOMBIE was released by ALBE PAVO in 2013 and sold out in just 3 months.The 1st Edition received acclaim from reviewers and players alike.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As we head into this campaign, the game is already set up for manufacturing, beside few details related to some stretch goal that we hope to unlock. We already have agreements with those in charge of production and shipping fulfillment. The estimated delivery date is Fall 2019. We do not expect any delay and our project schedule is conservative in terms of the time needed for follow-up after the campaign. 
This is our first Kickstarter, but it isn’t our first production. So we are well aware of all issues related to manufacturing and shipping. We do not believe there is any reason this production will be canceled but, in the unlikely event that we are unable to deliver the game, we will be refunding all pledges in full. This project is being funded in EU and any refunds processed will be in EUR for the exact amount received in EUR, excluding any applicable fees.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS
By pledging to this Kickstarter, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and rewards are subject to change and may differ from what is presented in this campaign. You agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order after receiving the shipping cost payment, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and that you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information, and ensuring this address is deliverable to by normal methods. We are unable to ship to P.O. Boxes.
If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.

updates.update_content:
Hello everybody,
today we are sharing with you another small update about the manufacturing process.
As probably many of you already know, with the coming of the hot season in China, since early June summer hotness started raging in southern districts and the Chinese local government had to cut power supply to manufacturies. Power shortages did not strike the cardboard line of our Factory but did so for the plastic line, so there has been some delay (manufacturies have power 4 days/week).

Hello everybody,
just a small update about the manufacturing process.
We've received the wooden components prototypes and we've just finished checking them: besides small issues on printed cubes (Pledge Manager add-on) that we are going to ask to fix, they're approved.

Hello guys,

today we want to update you about the manufacturing process and give you some more information about the Artwork Pledge. 

PROJECT UPDATE: MANUFACTURING PROCESS

Hello guys,
we have received a copy of the physical prototypes for molding from the Factory. We checked them carefully and, although we already requested some small improvement, we are honestly very satisfied with their quality. 
We are caring to maintain this level of detail.

Hello guys, as you know, the last miniature waiting for its final adaptation for molding was Tarantasio. 
The Big Snake (Tarantasio) is now going into physical prototyping together with all miniatures.
The adaptation phase for the first 25 miniatures has been smooth, with just sometimes an additional round of work for fixing minor details. Tarantasio is an 8 part miniature with a complex space unfolding, so this process took 3 adaptation rounds from both sides for having the factory perfectly understand the way we wanted it to be portrayed.

campaign.story:
This Kickstarter is for an expansion of Folklore: The Affliction, an immersive dark fantasy cooperative adventure. In this expansion, Fall of the Spire, your characters will continue the adventure through a series of stories in their quest to rid the land of evil. Advanced combat, and Town Events will make even the return trip to civilization more perilous. In addition, the Creature Crate, a Kickstarter Bonus, allows you to store all the miniatures from this campaign and previous ones!
Over 7,200 backers helped to make this game a reality. If you already own the core game, but are ready to delve deeper into the darkness, the “Squire” pledge level contains six full-length stories, and the “Executioner” has both the expansion and the new miniatures along with a Kickstarter bonus full game storage solution!Delve deeper below for more details!
 To see every thing that comes in the Folklore: The Affliction, The Dark Tales, The Spire, and the Creature Crate take a look at our graphic here.
 You have traveled the dangerous byways of Kremel, and finally walk past the gates of the town at twilight. Once eager to see so many people bustling in the streets, you have grown jaded and keep an eye out for pickpockets. Beneath the buildings, stone and wood edifices, you notice the layers of dust and grime, and a deepening of the shadows...  
 A shopkeeper waves in recognition as you walk through the town, and looks to you in hopes of news from the outside world. But you have a darker destination in mind, and no time to spare. You nod back, and take to the rooftops, and later descend to the sewers, where you hope to find the missing piece that will take you to the one place that will doom or save this land...the Dark Spire.
 The Characters 
Meet the new characters in Fall of the Spire. Each brings new skills and abilities to the game.
The Warlord
The Huntress

The Viper Maiden

The Gentleman
 The Foes and Afflictions 
The Woodmother is a KS Bonus mini.
The Lich is a Kickstarter Bonus
 A variety of evil waits for you at every turn. Foes can be found in skirmishes and encounters, while Afflictions, the puppet masters of Kremel, have grand designs on taking over this land.




 New Advanced Combat! 
Our advanced combat system adds a ton of awesome effects, choice and strategy to Folklore combat, such as the new Initiative Track as well as Initiative cards, Monster AI and Charge-Up powers! The Initiative cards give modifiers, bonus actions and special abilities or attacks to the characters and creatures who can take advantage of their position on the Initiative Track.  That’s not all, each Initiative card scales to adjust the effect and gameplay specifically for 2 players games, 3-4 player games and 5 player games!
Here’s how it works:
At the start of a fight, characters and creatures will roll for Initiative then place their minis or markers on the track according to their result (which can change based on bonuses from items, powers, artifacts, etc). Then, two Initiative cards are drawn, one for the characters and one for the creatures and each card is randomly assigned a slot on the Track.  The Initiative cards give a potential bonus or combat effect to either the character or foe in the indicated location. A character may spend power points to move up or down on the Track to take advantage of these power slots and the creatures can do the same! 
The entire advanced combat system is fully backwards compatible and can be used for ANY Folklore game such as the Core set or Dark Tales, not just the Fall of the Spire expansion!
That’s not all...Beware the Charge-up powers and effects that creatures will gain when in the heat of battle.  For every successful hit an enemy scores, they gain a charge counter, triggering a special AI, move, effect or ability on that creature as soon as 3 charges are scored. 
The Story
Using the narrative created by Twin Fire Games as your GM guide, follow the 6 new stories to see where each adventure takes you as you level up, gather supplies and move onward into certain danger! This next installation of stories added to your gaming library will allow you to journey further into the world of Folklore!
 The Events 
 The event decks add to the experience and depth of gameplay with small moments and longer side quests that can be integrated into the story or used on their own as you travel the world. If you do survive the Road and Off Road Event cards, there are always Rumor cards to send you down side paths that entice you to greater danger, and now Town Events will make even the return trip to civilization more perilous.
The Maps
 The Maps: Stunning artwork by Henning Ludvigsen brings to life new encounters on rooftops and underground to use alongside the well travelled paths in Kremel for dungeon crawls and combat with unearthly monsters! 
Fall of the Spire
All this and more awaits you in the Fall of the Spire expansion! Learn more on BGG! 
 Folklore: The Affliction is an adventure board game for 1-5 players, in which your characters progress through a series of stories in their quest to rid the land of evil. Every story is broken into chapters, allowing players to control the length of each game session. Become one of six unique characters, increasing in knowledge and skill as you embark on a frightful journey to save the world of Folklore from the horrors that plague it. Will you survive the adventure that awaits? Will your courage falter and your friends fail you? Or will you become legends? Open and find out…
Features
A cooperative campaign requiring no game master (including solo play)
Six stories with multiple paths and endings
Customize your character 
Unlock abilities, prayers, and rituals 
To find out more about Folklore: the Affliction core game, go to our website, join the Folklore Community page, and like us on BGG!
 Folklore: The Affliction is an immersive world steeped in mysteries for you to uncover, threads to follow and choices to make. It’s filled with many ways to customize and evolve your character, and dozens of asymmetrical monsters to master. With a focus on depth of play, Folklore retains the ability to get players right into the action without requiring you to study the rulebook before playing. All the key elements of play are taught via the story so you can begin your adventure immediately and learn the gameplay as you go.  
“This game really blurs the lines between RPG and a board game. Now in the past I’ve been really critical of games that try to be both an RPG and a board game, because normally I find they do neither of them very well; this is an amazing exception to that rule.”  ~ Robert Geistlinger, The Dice Tower, The Blue Player 
"This game is essentially an entire role playing game boiled down… easy to visualize and easy to play. There’s all types of variability through monsters, items, and abilities… but it's nice and accessible.” - Ryan Metzler, Dice Tower
"There have been a lot of games that have tried to give an RPG experience in a board game format. I have played a lot of them. I finally found one that does it with Folklore." ~ Lance Myxter, Undead Viking Videos
“Many people have asked us, “What is the closest board game to an RPG?” and I can now say that this game is absolutely the closest experience I’ve had. So much story, character development, choices, thought out missions, side quests during a specific mission... it pretty much kills every other ameritrashy campaign game I’ve tried thus far. We had a total blast with it. ” ~Jamie, Secret Cabal
It fits in that dungeon crawler category... but it's much more than that... I love this game. It's really a blend of so many things, you can't really pigeonhole it. It's the closest game I've ever played to an RPG that's still a board game… it’s very unique.”  ~Charlie Theel of Ding and Dent
One Stop Co-Op Shop’s How to Play Series
  "It’s a fun, really good story telling game!” 

Tim Jennette Overview and Review 
 “If you’re looking to ever to get into an RPG like D&D, I would highly recommend trying this first.” 
Man Versus Meeple Live Play

theMCGuiRE review
 “Man, I go on for a while on this one - over an hour actually!  this really is a great game and a fantastic implementation of your classic RPG but in a board game style and approach.  It has a ton of content and expansions already available.  Please look into this one and consider your options...  Excellent game!”

Die Rolling
 “Smashing!”

 Social
One thing we have done with this game is build a community. And thanks to it, we have made many wonderful friends along the way. But this is a new day, and there are new gamers out there who we hope to invite into the fold. The point of Folklore is be an immersive gaming experience that is accessible to everyone! We have worked hard to make our gameplay fun and friendly for every gamer and we carry that through to our community and even our Kickstarter stretch goals. To help reach out to the community, here’s what we have planned:

If we get 100 additional people signed up to our newsletter during the campaign, we will add 10 more Item cards in Fall of the Spire. UNLOCKED! 
 If we get 4,250 followers on our Facebook page during the campaign, we will add 10 more Town Event cards in Fall of the Spire.  UNLOCKED! 
If we get 3,050 followers on our Twitter page during the campaign, we will add 10 more Town Event cards in Fall of the Spire. UNLOCKED! 
If we get 550 followers on our Instagram page during the campaign, we will add 10 more Town Event cards in Fall of the Spire.  UNLOCKED! 
If the Folklore Community page reaches 2,400 members during the campaign, we will add 3 more Militia Companions in Fall of the Spire. UNLOCKED! 
 If we get up to 50 comments on this BGG thread during the campaign, we will add 3 more Animal Companions to Fall of the Spire!   UNLOCKED! 
 If we reach 925 likes on our Folklore: the Affliction BGG page during the campaign, we will add 15 Rumor Cards featuring special guests to the Creature Crate! UNLOCKED! 
 With 14 successful Kickstarters under our belt, we have learned a lot about what it takes to get our games into your hands. One of the biggest things is how variable the cost of shipping can be. As such, we will be charging shipping after this Kickstarter concludes, according to the actual costs incurred to ship to your area. We will do this through the pledge manager system once this Kickstarter has concluded.

ABOUT THE GAME 
From Weta Workshop and Trishula Entertainment comes District 9: The Boardgame, a competitive 2-4 player game based on the classic sci-fi film. Return to District 9 and relive the film’s final three days through a whole new perspective. Lead your Faction through the alien slum in a search for the tech that will give you the edge. Salvage the most technology, take control of the district, and claim your victory!
To buy an Add-On, simply increase your pledge by that amount. You’ll be able to choose how your money gets spent in our Pledge Manager, when the campaign ends. 
Check out our work-in-progress rulebook here.
We sent pre-production games to some of the most discerning game reviewers on YouTube - here's what they have to say:  
Shipping for District 9: The Boardgame will be charged once the Kickstarter campaign has ended, based on the actual cost of shipping your game. 
Our Pledge Manager will step you through the process. This opens a few weeks after the end of the Kickstarter.
In the meantime, we have listed shipping estimates for each tier in the table below. Please note that these costs are not final. Shipping will be charged based on the actual cost of shipping your game, applicable stretch goals, and any add-ons you choose, to your chosen destination. The "Base Game" column has been added to show what just the base game (without stretch goals) would cost to ship as some backers have requested this.
We have put the United Kingdom separate from the European Union as we are conscious the UK's customs status is currently under review. If at the time of shipping, the UK is still within the EU customs zone, shipments to the UK will follow the rules for the EU.
We regret to advise that we cannot ship to these territories: Russia, Central African Republic, Comoros, Cuba, Equatorial Guinea, Falklands, Guinea Bissau, Iran, Johnston Island, Kiribati, North Korea, Mayotte Island, Myanmar, Nauru, Niue, Saint Pierre Et Miquelon, Sao Tome & Principe, Sierra Leone, Solomon Islands, Somalia, St Helena, Sudan, Syria, Tajikistan, Tokelau Islands, Republic of Turkmenistan, Tuvalu, Wake Islands.
Pledges confirmed after our Pledge Manager closes will be shipped from our New Zealand hub at backer cost, later in the year. We recommend you keep an eye on your Kickstarter updates for information about the pledge manager due date.
Got a question about your game? You can reach our Customer Service team at support@wetanz.co.nz. To help speed things up, please quote your order number in your email.

We’ve put a lot of careful planning into this, our second Kickstarter. We’re ready to kick off the production of District 9 the moment our campaign has been funded, but it’s important to note that there are no guarantees in this process. There is always the potential for unexpected delays or issues that affect production, manufacture, or shipping. 

We’ve been working hard to minimise any potential issues. Our Consumer Products division is managing the production of the D9 Kickstarter. They’ve been successfully creating and shipping all sorts of incredible products for 20 years. Our production and distribution channels are well established and firing on all cylinders. We’re committed to keeping you updated and in the loop, every step on our journey back to the District.

Refund Policy
No-questions-asked refunds will be issued up to 14 days after the close of the Kickstarter. After this period, store credit will be offered in lieu of a refund.

After the Pledge Manager has closed, offers of refunds or store credit will be at the discretion of Weta Workshop, acting in accordance with applicable consumer law.

In the event that we are not able to deliver your game due to an error or mistake on our part, we will refund you in full. If we are unable to deliver your game due to change of address or backer error, we will redeliver at backer cost or issue store credit.

Refunds will be issued in USD, at the exchange rate applicable at the time of the refund.

updates.update_content:
District 9: The Boardgame has been a journey into the universe created for the film that started in the fall of 2017. It’s been a long process with various hurdles along the way, innumerable playtest sessions, discarded concepts, mechanics, and crazy ideas that seemed obvious after we implemented them. It’s also been an experience that we’ve loved every moment of. 
Every game design begins with an idea. A source of inspiration. Whether it's a theme, a specific game mechanic, or even just a single character sketch to center things around. When you're designing a new game, you're also designing a “new” universe for it to take place in. When that universe is new, you basically set all of the rules and allowances.

Hi Prawn lovers!
Last update, we talked you through the 36 sculpted miniatures in the core game. Today, we want to show you the whole shebang - all 56 unique Weta Workshop sculpted miniatures, art directed by Gary Hunt!
